  TITLE: Rondo alla turca [from Piano Sonata No. 11 A major KV 331]
 ARTIST: Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart

/Vaca_Ramiro/Rock_n_Roll.sid
COMMENT: Despite popular belief, the Amiga version of the tune by Chris
         Hülsbeck is the cover of this C64 original (done by Ramiro), not vice
         versa.
         "There was some tune-swapping going on, as Chris was assigned [to do]
         the music for Circus Attractions while Ramiro had the pleasure of
         doing Rock'n'Roll. Now Chris hated circus music as much as Ramiro
         hated R'n'R. Therefore, Ramiro composed part of the Circus Attractions
         title music [and] Chris at some stage helped Ramiro with the R'n'R
         musics, but it is unclear in what way. [...]" (All info is from Miron
         Schmidt.)
(#1)
 AUTHOR: Chris Hülsbeck
COMMENT: Covers the Amiga version.
(#5)
  TITLE: Loco-Motion
 ARTIST: Little Eva
COMMENT: Based on the version sang by Kylie Minogue.

/Vaca_Ramiro/SM_End_Sequence.sid
COMMENT: "SM" is probably short for "Soundmonitor" here. This song was a
         prelimimary version of the Turrican end title, which was then dropped
         in favour of the song he composed in the end (done with TFMX). (Info
         from Miron Schmidt)

/Vaca_Ramiro/Startrash.sid
(#1)
 AUTHOR: Chris Hülsbeck
(#2)
 AUTHOR: Ramiro Vaca
(#3)
 AUTHOR: Ramiro Vaca
(#4)
 AUTHOR: Ramiro Vaca

### Agemixer #################################################################

/VARIOUS/A-F/Agemixer/
COMMENT: Comments from Ari Yliaho (Agemixer) are denoted by (AY).

/VARIOUS/A-F/Agemixer/Audio_Man_in-game_tune_2.sid
COMMENT: This is the original version of the tune. The version from "Royal
         Arte" demo has a specific playroutine and sounds a little different.

/VARIOUS/A-F/Agemixer/Azmagutah_6581.sid
COMMENT: Agemixer made two versions of this tune, so that the tune would sound
         exactly the same if the right SID chip was used.
         This is the 6581 SID chip version.

/VARIOUS/A-F/Agemixer/Azmagutah_8580.sid
COMMENT: Agemixer made two versions of this tune, so that the tune would sound
         exactly the same if the right SID chip was used.
         This is the 8580 SID chip version.

/VARIOUS/A-F/Agemixer/Breath_of_Fire.sid
COMMENT: This tune was first released in "Album of the Year". The demo in
         places mistitled the tune "Birth of Fire" by accident.

/VARIOUS/A-F/Agemixer/Bronskizak.sid
  TITLE: Smalltown Boy [from The Age of Consent] (0:00-0:30)
 ARTIST: Bronski Beat
  TITLE: Smalltown Boy [from The Age of Consent] (1:01-1:16)
 ARTIST: Bronski Beat

 ARTIST: Bronski Beat

         actual songs for it." (AY)

/VARIOUS/A-F/Agemixer/Commando_Remix.sid
  TITLE: Commando, Tune #1
 ARTIST: Rob Hubbard

         part to Padua's "Splish Splash Demo", at Mekka and Symposium 1998."
         (AY)

/VARIOUS/A-F/Agemixer/Kummatti_City.sid

 ARTIST: Ari Yliaho (Agemixer)
COMMENT: "'Kummatti' was actually a dark, tedious and little part of the town
         where i lived during my studytime. The name 'Kummatti City' is just
         sarcasm..." (AY)

/VARIOUS/A-F/Agemixer/Let_Me_Hear_You_Say_Yeah.sid
  TITLE: Let Me Hear You Say Yeah
 ARTIST: FBI Project

/VARIOUS/A-F/Agemixer/Little_Lies.sid
  TITLE: Little Lies [from Tango in the Night]
 ARTIST: Fleetwood Mac

/VARIOUS/A-F/Agemixer/National_Park_jonga_mix.sid
COMMENT: "This is one theme of our jonga live music show at Kaustinen Folk
         music festival.  The persons playing were:
         Petri Ala-Louesniemi: Hungarian Moon harp with Jonga reverb
         Anton Bruhin: Moon harps, jews harp
         Ari Yliaho: telescope digeridoo
         Unknown band visitor: talking drum". (AY)

/VARIOUS/A-F/Agemixer/Nightshift.sid
COMMENT: This sid has won the Core 2001 music competition.

/VARIOUS/A-F/Agemixer/Patakakkonen.sid
  TITLE: Patakakkonen
 ARTIST: <?>
COMMENT: "A Finnish cooking show on TV, originally an old Finnish folk song
         whistled by many a chef. The original tune is a legend itself... The
         tune was made just for fun while I was talking with Janne Suni
         (Tempest/Damage) on the phone. We laughed on the floor for this
         comical melody while composing it... Sorry, no recipes here! (Later on
         the tune was released with Snacks #1 infofile.)" (AY)

/VARIOUS/A-F/Agemixer/Sit_In_My_Underwear.sid
   NAME: Sit In My Underwear, Drinking Pepsi

/VARIOUS/A-F/Blues_Muz/Gallefoss_Glenn/Ode_to_Bugg.sid
  TITLE: <?> [from the Amiga MOD module]
 ARTIST: Bug
COMMENT: "[A cover of] Mystified by Jogeir Lijehdal.  [However], when I showed
         Geir Tjelta this tune, I had another name for it..  And then he came
         with this story about Bug or Bogg having done the original tune and
         that he had committed suicide.. So I changed the name of the tune to
         'Ode to Bugg' .." (GRG).
         Stein Erik Giske (Bug of Subway, Razor 1911) was killed in 1992 as a
         result of a car accident, and not suicide (Info from Jan Harries)

### Kristian Roestoeen #######################################################

/VARIOUS/A-F/Blues_Muz/Roestoeen_Kristian/
COMMENT: Comments by Kristian himself are denoted by (KR).

         live." (KR)

COMMENT: "Kinda happy happy joy joy song... there's a sequence in the middle
         which is a cover of some children's TV-theme but I can't quite
         remember which." (KR)

  TITLE: Bamses fødselsdag <?> (0:00-0:23)
 ARTIST: Christian Hartmann & Thorbjörn Egner

  TITLE: Spend Some Time [from Brother Sister]
 ARTIST: Brand New Heavies
COMMENT: "The first bass is built on a song by a group called Brand New
         Heavies." (KR)

/VARIOUS/A-F/Blues_Muz/Roestoeen_Kristian/Dum_Da_Dum.sid
COMMENT: "One of my very favourite tunes. Too bad Glenn Rune fucked up when
         putting a player on it - an echo voice in the last section
         disappeared! ;) This calls for a remix hehe..." (KR)

/VARIOUS/A-F/Blues_Muz/Roestoeen_Kristian/End_of.sid
COMMENT: "End of what!?!? I for one sure as hell can't remember!" (KR)

/VARIOUS/A-F/Blues_Muz/Roestoeen_Kristian/Ferro.sid
COMMENT: "I remember Olav Mørkrid/Panoramic Designs helped me with some
         instruments on this one... over the phone! :)" (KR)

/VARIOUS/A-F/Blues_Muz/Roestoeen_Kristian/Happy_End.sid
COMMENT: "Have to admit I kinda like this one... relaxing." (KR)

/VARIOUS/A-F/Blues_Muz/Roestoeen_Kristian/Hercules.sid
COMMENT: "A bit inspired by the Navy Seals score by Maniacs of Noise.
         Unfortunately, the arpeggios fucked up a tad when putting a player on
         it." (KR)

/VARIOUS/A-F/Blues_Muz/Roestoeen_Kristian/Ibanez.sid
COMMENT: "This is actually the work of Frode/Megastyle. That is, he sat next to
         me playing it on the guitar while I converted it to the C-64..." (KR)

/VARIOUS/A-F/Blues_Muz/Roestoeen_Kristian/Jazzy_Arafat.sid
COMMENT: "I think I made this tune just so I could use that title... ;)" (KR)

/VARIOUS/A-F/Blues_Muz/Roestoeen_Kristian/Kimberly.sid
COMMENT: "This song sounds terrible in SIDplay. Wire it over to the C-64 and
         try again." (KR)

/VARIOUS/A-F/Blues_Muz/Roestoeen_Kristian/Koivinen.sid
COMMENT: "It's cheap but I kinda like it anyway... typical me, I like all kinds
         of crap." (KR)

/VARIOUS/A-F/Blues_Muz/Roestoeen_Kristian/Lost_Lust.sid
COMMENT: "Made for the magazine Skyhigh. The opening chords are based on the
         classic song called 'Ain't Nobody' by Chaka Kahn." (KR)

/VARIOUS/A-F/Blues_Muz/Roestoeen_Kristian/Madness.sid
COMMENT: "Yet again, one of my favourites... kinda crazy tune. Sounds MUCH
         better on the C-64." (KR)

### Boogaloo #################################################################

  TITLE: Test Drive II: The Duel (remix)
 ARTIST: Kris Hatlelid

/VARIOUS/A-F/Boogaloo/Snake_Fighter.sid
COMMENT: All those weird references to snakes (eg the HZ demo "Snake or Die")
         comes from strange Horizon rituals. At the HZ party in Vårby 1989 the
         HZ members were not only dressed in training suits with HZ logotypes,
         they also brought rubber snakes bought from the closest toy store,
         which they used to whip visitors and each other with. (Spank! Spank!)

### Chotaire #################################################################

/VARIOUS/A-F/Chotaire/Always_Looking.sid
  TITLE: Always Look on the Bright Side of Life [from movie The Life of Brian]
 ARTIST: Eric Idle (music & text)
COMMENT: From Monty Python's movie, which was banned from UK television release
         until 1994.

/VARIOUS/A-F/Chotaire/Blue_Mountains.sid
  TITLE: When the Chariot Comes
 ARTIST: Traditional Negro Spiritual

/VARIOUS/A-F/Chotaire/Hit_the_Shit.sid
  TITLE: <?> (Unknownr.sid)
 ARTIST: Reyn Ouwehand

/VARIOUS/A-F/Chotaire/Positive.sid
COMMENT: "[...] But now let me tell something about this music. It was composed
         and tracked within  hours on january, 23rd. This is a kind of jazz
         tune, it's not my style ya know, but I felt like doing a tune like
         this because lots a people like it. Therefore I added sum of my music
         style to the tune, that's why it sounds a bit techno like.. Try to
         enjoy this tune with a stereo, you'll like it I guess.. By the way
         remember that all C128 computers have a different filter set on their
         sid chips,so the music sounds a bit different than on normal c64
         computers, you'll hear the difference on the bass, the filters doesn't
         open theirselves so much on C128! But who the fuck cares, this music
         runs on all computers, that's what counts! [...]"
         (Taken from a note added to the tune "Positive" by Chotaire himself)

/VARIOUS/A-F/Chotaire/Rhythm_is_a_Dancer.sid
  TITLE: Rhythm is a Dancer
 ARTIST: Snap

/VARIOUS/A-F/Chotaire/Technology_2.sid
  TITLE: Our Darkness
 ARTIST: Anne Clark

/VARIOUS/A-F/CreaMD/I_Am_In_Love.sid
COMMENT: This tune was first released in "Album of the Year".
         "I composed it when I was in love with a girl called Galina. She had
         short dark brown hair, blue eyes and a beautiful face. At least I
         thought so. She was self-confident, charismatic, not this tell me what
         I should do and I will do it master type. I loved her but still didn't
         know what she really thought. She left the university and didn't reply
         on my letters. Maybe when I'm older I'll write some memoirs and I will
         write the full story then." (Comment by CreaMD)

/VARIOUS/A-F/CreaMD/Missing_You.sid
  TITLE: Every Breath You Take
 ARTIST: The Police
COMMENT: Based on Puff Daddy's remake "Missing You".

 ARTIST: <?>
COMMENT: Covers Warren Pilkington's C64 cover, which is
         /VARIOUS/S-Z/Waz/Tribute_To_The_Atari_2600.sid, Tune #3.
(#2)
  TITLE: Pressure Cooker [from the Atari 2600 game]
 ARTIST: <?>
COMMENT: Covers Warren Pilkington's C64 cover, which is
         /VARIOUS/S-Z/Waz/Tribute_To_The_Atari_2600.sid, Tune #3.

### ELA ######################################################################

/VARIOUS/A-F/ELA/
COMMENT: Comments by ELA himself are denoted by (x,y ELA). x is a number that
         shows ELA's personal ranking of a given tune (9 being the best), and y
         is a number that shows how much a given tune was used (0=never
         released, 9=used by many).

/VARIOUS/A-F/ELA/Carl_I_Hagen.sid
COMMENT: "Made with the newer Future Composers by BeastieBoys etc. as a member
         of Suppliers.
         Shorty. Cool though!" (7,1 ELA)

/VARIOUS/A-F/ELA/Choir_inspired_stuff.sid
COMMENT: "Made with Megastyle's editor. Quit Cosine, and got word from
         Megastyle that they wanted me as a member making tons of
         intro/demo-tunes. I got their editor but they never used ANY of my
         music. Their player was based on JB/MON's Stormlord tunes. I decided
         to join my local friends in the Norway/Finland/Germany-based group
         Antimon. Most of my music had been used by them anyway.
         A somewhat choir-like tune!" (2,0 ELA)

/VARIOUS/A-F/ELA/Cirkus_Death.sid
COMMENT: "Made with the newer Future Composers by BeastieBoys etc. as a member
         of of Cosine (English guys). Cosine had their own music division, but
         never had any intensions of including me in it and letting me use
         their routine!
         It's a rotten tune, with lots of bass/filter and no melody." (5,4 ELA)

/VARIOUS/A-F/ELA/Complete_solo.sid
COMMENT: "Made with the newer Future Composers by BeastieBoys etc. as a member
         of Suppliers.
         Ok! But the ending is awful!" (6,0 ELA)

/VARIOUS/A-F/ELA/Concluded_Errors.sid
COMMENT: "Made with the newer Future Composers by BeastieBoys etc. as a member
         of Suppliers.
         Made for the Errors, but they didn't use it." (7,0 ELA)

/VARIOUS/A-F/ELA/Desperate.sid
COMMENT: "Made with Megastyle's editor. Quit Cosine, and got word from
         Megastyle that they wanted me as a member making tons of
         intro/demo-tunes. I got their editor but they never used ANY of my
         music. Their player was based on JB/MON's Stormlord tunes. I decided
         to join my local friends in the Norway/Finland/Germany-based group
         Antimon. Most of my music had been used by them anyway." (9,1 ELA)

/VARIOUS/A-F/ELA/En_annen_gang.sid
COMMENT: "Made in SoundMonitor as a member of MG-2 (very unknown) and then
         Suppliers (SPL).
         Starting to get frustrated." (3,0 ELA)

/VARIOUS/A-F/ELA/Filter_bass.sid
COMMENT: "Made in SoundMonitor as a member of MG-2 (very unknown) and then
         Suppliers (SPL).
         Very nice bass." (8,0 ELA)

/VARIOUS/A-F/ELA/Flesk.sid
COMMENT: "Made with Megastyle's editor. Quit Cosine, and got word from
         Megastyle that they wanted me as a member making tons of
         intro/demo-tunes. I got their editor but they never used ANY of my
         music. Their player was based on JB/MON's Stormlord tunes. I decided
         to join my local friends in the Norway/Finland/Germany-based group
         Antimon. Most of my music had been used by them anyway.
         This sound weird, but drives on & on." (8,0 ELA)

/VARIOUS/A-F/ELA/Frantic_2.sid
COMMENT: "Made with the newer Future Composers by BeastieBoys etc. as a member
         of Suppliers.
         Considered my best by others. There never was a Frantic1." (9,7 ELA)

/VARIOUS/A-F/ELA/Frantic_3.sid
COMMENT: "Made with the newer Future Composers by BeastieBoys etc. as a member
         of Suppliers.
         A great intro tune." (9,2 ELA)

/VARIOUS/A-F/ELA/Hans_Inge_Tune.sid
COMMENT: "Made with Finnish Gold's Future Composer as a member of Suppliers,
         but most tunes were used just by the newly formed Antimon!
         A choirsong-transfer. An early hit and used a lot." (8,8 ELA)

/VARIOUS/A-F/ELA/Intro_Bug.sid
COMMENT: "Made in SoundMonitor as a member of MG-2 (very unknown) and then
         Suppliers (SPL).
         One of my first." (5,0 ELA)

/VARIOUS/A-F/ELA/JCH-like_tune.sid
COMMENT: "Made with the newer Future Composers by BeastieBoys etc. as a member
         of Suppliers.
         When I'd made it I needed a name. It sounded somewhat like JCH, so I
         gave it his name." (5,0 ELA)

/VARIOUS/A-F/ELA/Megastylie.sid
COMMENT: "Made with the newer Future Composers by BeastieBoys etc. as a member
         of of Cosine (English guys). Cosine had their own music division, but
         never had any intensions of including me in it and letting me use
         their routine!
         Made for Megatyle. Never used...Crapheads!" (8,0 ELA)

/VARIOUS/A-F/ELA/Nobodys_Igle.sid
COMMENT: "Made with Finnish Gold's Future Composer as a member of Suppliers,
         but most tunes were used just by the newly formed Antimon!
         Used in a SmallShittyDemo by Suppliers." (3,2 ELA)

/VARIOUS/A-F/ELA/Running_in_the_woods.sid
COMMENT: "Made with the newer Future Composers by BeastieBoys etc. as a member
         of of Cosine (English guys). Cosine had their own music division, but
         never had any intensions of including me in it and letting me use
         their routine!
         Short test! It works quite well." (7,0 ELA)

/VARIOUS/A-F/ELA/Rythmic_5_er.sid
COMMENT: "Made with the newer Future Composers by BeastieBoys etc. as a member
         of Suppliers.
         This has a weird count, kind of 5 beats instead of 4. It's not 5/4,
         but... something else... A nice slap bass in the last sequence." (6,1
         ELA)

/VARIOUS/A-F/ELA/Sec_Gallup.sid
COMMENT: "Made with Finnish Gold's Future Composer as a member of Suppliers,
         but most tunes were used just by the newly formed Antimon!
         Lots of bass riffs and little melody." (6,2 ELA)

/VARIOUS/A-F/ELA/SingAlongSong.sid
COMMENT: "Made with the newer Future Composers by BeastieBoys etc. as a member
         of Suppliers.
         Quite nice." (7,0 ELA)

/VARIOUS/A-F/ELA/Stoff_Deboot.sid
COMMENT: "Made with Finnish Gold's Future Composer as a member of Suppliers,
         but most tunes were used just by the newly formed Antimon!
         Made especially for SPL, never used!" (7,0 ELA)

/VARIOUS/A-F/ELA/Summer_88.sid
COMMENT: "Made with the newer Future Composers by BeastieBoys etc. as a member
         of Suppliers.
         Made out of an old synth-tune of mine." (9,4 ELA)

/VARIOUS/A-F/ELA/Tune_4.sid
COMMENT: "Made with the newer Future Composers by BeastieBoys etc. as a member
         of Suppliers.
         A simple intro tune." (5,1 ELA)

/VARIOUS/A-F/ELA/Very_Ode_Yeah.sid
COMMENT: "Made with the newer Future Composers by BeastieBoys etc. as a member
         of of Cosine (English guys). Cosine had their own music division, but

         denoted by (AR).

         co-op tunes with The Syndrom, and you'll find those in his directory
         in HVSC." (AR)

COMMENT: "And again a 4K 1st place at Mekka Symposium 2001." (AR)

/VARIOUS/A-F/Fanta/Aquanori.sid
COMMENT: "Got 4th place at X 2001." (AR)

/VARIOUS/A-F/Fanta/Bemme_Mit_Brot.sid
COMMENT: "The demo (One-Der) got 2nd place at The Party 1997. Drax asked me
         once what "Bemme" means and believe me, it wasn´t easy to explain the
         sense of this title, because it´s saxon (Hi Happymaker, diese Elite
         Kunden wissn ooch nüscht, nur?). The correct translation is bread
         slice with bread. :-)" (AR)

/VARIOUS/A-F/Fanta/Brummkreisel.sid
  TITLE: Pop Goes the Weasel (1:24-1:32)
 ARTIST: Traditional
COMMENT: "Originally made for Respect/Fuse. The Syndrom thought it was too
         funny for such a serious demo, haha! So I gave it to Acidchild for his
         notes. Every scener had a Brummkreisel but Acidchild two! :-))" (AR)

/VARIOUS/A-F/Fanta/Drop_The_Girl.sid
COMMENT: "D-Tract left the scene for his girlfriend and so he had some
         worktunes left. I liked this one and finished it by assembling the
         subtunes and adding some small things like instruments or a melody
         part in the end. The main job was done by him." (AR)

/VARIOUS/A-F/Fanta/Emergency_Brake.sid
COMMENT: "Cool story about The Tribute 1994. The Oxyron guys (who I joined
         later) came into the room asking "How much time have we left till the
         deadline? 30 hours? Ok, we make a demo!" and started. They asked for
         msx and gfx and this was the tune I had left at that time. Well..."
         (AR)

/VARIOUS/A-F/Fanta/Ferrero.sid
COMMENT: "Got 7th place at Mekka Symposium 1999. Partyvoting sometimes sucks

### Greatrix #################################################################

/VARIOUS/G-L/Greatrix/Aufidazin_Monty_Cover.sid
  TITLE: Auf Wiedersehen Monty, Tune #1
 ARTIST: Rob Hubbard & Ben Daglish

/VARIOUS/G-L/Greatrix/VHD.sid
COMMENT: Due to many complaints about the voting system done at competition
         parties (mainly PC users voting for the C64 competition), Greatrix
         decided to enter the competition with a deliberate pathetic tune. His
         goal was to see if his dismal creation could score higher than some of
         the real competitors proving the system was a complete farce. For this
         particular competition, SymMek98, Greatrix's tune rightfully finished
         last.

### H.M.Murdock ##############################################################

  TITLE: Just Can't Get Enough [from Speak & Spell]
 ARTIST: Depeche Mode

### Hannula, Antti ###########################################################

/VARIOUS/G-L/Hannula_Antti/
COMMENT: All comments by Antti Hannula (AH)
         "I practiced a lot making sids in the late 1980s but released my
         first tunes in 1990.  After Antti Kangas (Scorpion) finished
         his first music routine for Artline Designs (ALD) we started to
         release "quality-sounds".  Before ALD I was the founder member of
         Contex.  All tunes were composed with an assembler.  Reach me via
         anttihan@hotmail.com" (AH)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Hannula_Antti/Artlight_Zone.sid
  TITLE: The Twilight Zone [from the TV series]
 ARTIST: Lalo Schifrin
COMMENT: "My first 'good' song with ALD-player v2.1 and one of the few covers I
         ever did. V2.1 didn't have any pulse data for $41 sounds so therefore
         I just used $11 or $21 to have acceptable melody-sounds.
         I was just playing around with the routine and somehow the Zone-theme
         appeared into my mind, but it's only influenced by the theme and the
         rest of the tune was just an effort of imagination.
         Done in January/February 1990." (AH)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Hannula_Antti/ATA.sid
COMMENT: "Released in 1992, made with ALD-player v3.0 which was developed late
         1990. The routine turned out to be the one I used most, though v3.7
         was even ready at the time.
         The tune itself was the first one I was asked to do for a game. ATA
         was a Tetris-clone done by German Lower Level and I don't recall if I
         got paid for the track, but anyway it was liked by the authors and
         apparently many others.
         This must have been the best track I've done if I don't take count on
         my new tunes. I wasn't anymore much into composing that time, I just
         composed as a time-killer. Also a high score track was included." (AH)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Hannula_Antti/B-Ball.sid
COMMENT: "The B-Ball sounds were ordered in the Autumn 92 just after I had
         released my second music-collection which apparently didn't get spread
         much as I sent it to my old pals, which I even didn't know if they
         were in the scene anymore or not. The B-Ball track however, never got
         released as the game wasn't sold (I guess). I liked this track a lot
         myself and in fact it was the first time I had to do jingles. The
         player I used was v3.6. B-Ball was the last (finished) track I did
         until now in 1999." (AH)
(#1)
   NAME: Main Tune
(#2)
   NAME: Get Ready
(#3)
   NAME: Game Over
(#4)
   NAME: In-game Tune

/VARIOUS/G-L/Hannula_Antti/Beyond_Grave.sid
COMMENT: "Done in April 1999, yes! The first C64 tune after 1992. This tune
         participated in Proxy 99 party in Finland, even though I wasn't
         present it won the C64 music competition. Some people were really
         amazed to see a track from me for a long long time. I made the basis
         for it with Fasttracker and this is the way I compose the tunes these
         days. It's not a hard job to 'convert' the into assembler if you just
         make the tunes in a 64-style." (AH)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Hannula_Antti/Compact.sid
COMMENT: "Yet another one done in April 1999. I fixed this one just after
         Beyond Grave, but this one I did with the old style - just playing
         around with the routine. Later on I discovered that the arpeggios
         turned out to be much like in Hawkeye by Jeroen Tel. I intended to do
         a slow tune and this is what came out of my head." (AH)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Hannula_Antti/Conflex.sid
COMMENT: "Done in 1990 with v3.0 and was released in my Music Pack #1.
         Nothing special there though I remember I liked it very much back in
         1990. Somehow the "wind-effect" turned out to be in many of my tunes,
         including this one as well. The name comes from Con(tex) and Flex."
         (AH)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Hannula_Antti/Discoland.sid
COMMENT: "I composed this one with Fasttracker II and of course with c64
         sounds. This time transforming the .xm into our c64 music-routine
         turned out to be quite tricky (maybe I just wasn`t in the mood)...
         Anyway, I like the melody and I say that`s the most important element
         in a sid tune." (AH)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Hannula_Antti/Drivers_Dog.sid
COMMENT: "The name comes from Shell`s hot dog which I often eat when coming
         home from my DJ gigs. Quite funky tune and I`m quite pleased with the
         "2nd part" of the song. Uses player v3.7 which was the last ALD-player
         and is the only one which offers you the chance to put bassdrum into
         bass-sound." (AH)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Hannula_Antti/FanFarewell.sid
COMMENT: "V2.8 production which was a huge step in sounds compared to v2.1 or
         v2.4. I made several tunes with this player back in 1990. The tune
         itself is just a fanfare as you can hear, you could say that this was
         my first high-score track!" (AH)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Hannula_Antti/Feelin_Blue.sid
COMMENT: "Was actually my first released tune and used in the last Contex demo
         called "Handjob Lotion" released May 1990. Used player v2.1 and you
         can hear it from the $21 melody sound. I remember Zardax/Origo played
         this melody in the air pretending there was a keyboard under his
         fingers and asked me what is the song he's playing.. of course I knew
         it!" (AH)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Hannula_Antti/Frazze.sid
COMMENT: "Also in "Handjob Lotion" and done with v2.1 as well. This time I used
         $11 melody-sound. Afterwards I've been told this one was at least used
         in a Talent-intro and in Royal Writer. Someone's been liking it." (AH)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Hannula_Antti/Frequency_69.sid
COMMENT: "Done somewhere around late 1991 and released 1992. This was my effort
         to do a techno-track. Uses $15 or $17 ring modulation, $11 bass-drum
         and $11 bass which is played low. I just loved using low frequency
         bass (LFO/LFO) and the tune was inspired by a band called Rhythmatic.
         Scrap/Genesis Project (ex-Contex) reviewed this tune and commented 'Is
         my compu broken?'" (AH)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Hannula_Antti/Ghettoblaster.sid
COMMENT: "Player v2.8. This tune appeared to sound like a general Finnish
         melancholic tune. Nothing special in it." (AH)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Hannula_Antti/Jammin.sid
COMMENT: "This one was meant to be a jamming intro-tune, nothing else. I
         created a "going" bassline and simple chorus into it and later on I
         added a short melody. I like it!" (AH)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Hannula_Antti/Mello-D_Pop.sid
COMMENT: "I can recall quite clearly that I designed the arpeggios with my
         synthesizer and that was all I needed. I also used to create the
         melodies by playing the bass and chorus from C64 and the melody from
         the synth, it was quite easy. However, I should have done longer
         melodies, too often the melody lasted for 16 beats and then I just
         repeated it." (AH)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Hannula_Antti/Mindblowing.sid
COMMENT: "The intro music for "The Return of A" - my music collection #2.
         The first time I used $11 in arpeggios. I think this tune got its
         right atmosphere right from the beginning. The pulse bassdrum was
         meant to be as a heartbeat, oooh I loved the bass-sound. So simple so
         cool!" (AH)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Hannula_Antti/My_First_Introtune.sid
COMMENT: "OK, who could have avoided Future Composer? I practiced a lot with it
         and this one was actually made back in 1988, but I never got the
         courage to release it.. I wonder why, after eleven years it actually
         sounds quite nice (done by me when I was 14)." (AH)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Hannula_Antti/Needle.sid
COMMENT: "I don't know what there is, but I like this one though many others
         did not. Perhaps the minimal sounds... It's just so simple!!" (AH)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Hannula_Antti/Peggy.sid
  TITLE: Peggy
 ARTIST: Jarmo Nikku, performed by Samuli Edelmann
COMMENT: "My first actual cover, done in 1991. This song was chosen the "Song
         of Autumn" in Finnish TV, by the viewers. This was one of my
         favourites on my music-collection #2. Anyway, now I prefer the remix."
         (AH)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Hannula_Antti/Peggy_remix.sid
  TITLE: Peggy
 ARTIST: Jarmo Nikku, performed by Samuli Edelmann
COMMENT: "This version got it going... Well, ain`t that what a remix is
         supposed to do." (AH)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Hannula_Antti/Quite_Acid.sid
COMMENT: "The bassline I'm using in this one was very typical for the early
         acid/house tracks back in 1990, you see I was really into it. Just for
         intros!" (AH)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Hannula_Antti/Reflection.sid
COMMENT: "Done in 1992. This song must have started from the bassline!" (AH)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Hannula_Antti/Russian.sid
  TITLE: Stepnaja Kavalerijskaja (The March of the Red Cavalry)
 ARTIST: Traditional, Russian folk song
COMMENT: "I was searching for notebooks and then I found this one. There was no
         need to take a closer look, I went to the computer and in a while it
         was ready." (AH)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Hannula_Antti/Superstitious.sid
COMMENT: "The bass and chorus must sound familiar, eh? I think this one is
         boring, well it was my first tune which lasted more than 4 minutes.
         Done in 1990 (v2.8)" (AH)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Hannula_Antti/Swing_it.sid
COMMENT: "This must have been a fast-made track, got the feeling., I don't
         remember how it got spread, but I was surprised to see it in the HVSC.
         Probably done in 1991 for Giants (?)" (AH)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Hannula_Antti/Swing_it_2.sid
COMMENT: "Well, this is the one that actually swings! Done in April 1992 and
         released separately at the same time as music collection #2. This one
         is an exception to my usual formula which was "there must be a
         bassline and drums with melody". (AH)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Hannula_Antti/Tekno_A-Sid.sid
COMMENT: "You could say this one is the sequel to Frequency 69, more low bass
         and a nice rhythm. Done in February 1992 and released separately on
         the same disk as music collection #2. Grooovy!!" (AH)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Hannula_Antti/Theme.sid
COMMENT: "Yet another one of my new tunes done in 1999. This piece participated
         in the Assembly`99 music-compo and gained the 5th place. Done with our
         old player v3.1 done back in 1990 or something. One of my own the
         favourites." (AH)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Hannula_Antti/Weekend.sid
COMMENT: "My first longer tune done back in 1990 with v2.8. Well, you could say
         that this is a prototype of what my music was back in 1990. Sounded
         too much the same.." (AH)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Hannula_Antti/Wicked_Thing.sid
COMMENT: "Done in 1992. One of the tunes I dislike :-(" (AH)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Hannula_Antti/Wonderland.sid
  TITLE: Satumaa
 ARTIST: Unto Mononen, performed by Eino Grön
COMMENT: "This is a cover of the most popular Finnish tango ever. I translated
         the arpeggios directly from a notebook (but where is the tango-beat?).
         Still the most played song in Finnish radio and an all time Finnish
         people's favourite!" (AH)

/VARIOUS/G-L/KB/F_A_K_E-End_music_GameBoy.sid
COMMENT: "This was the background zak for the end scroller. As this end
         scroller was NOT faked, I decided to use only plain, non-modulated,
         non-filtered square waves... this is why I called this "GameBoy
         version", it simply sounds like sum Super Mario or stuff end tune :)"
         (KB)

/VARIOUS/G-L/KB/F_A_K_E-Main_music.sid
  TITLE: Unreal II - The 2nd Reality [from the PC demo] (0:00-0:30)
 ARTIST: Jonne Valtonen (Purple Motion of Future Crew)

/VARIOUS/G-L/KB/F_A_K_E-The_End_remixed.sid
  TITLE: F.A.K.E. End Music
 ARTIST: Tammo Hinrichs (KB)

/VARIOUS/G-L/KB/First_25Hz_tune_half-speed.sid
COMMENT: "As one of our members had coded a demo part which sucked such an
         amount of time that it was impossible to have a music routine running
         every frame, I was forced to compose a zak which ran at a speed of
         25Hz instead of 50. Pity-ful, this part was never released but it was
         a nice experiment how to cope with all these drum fx when you can't
         really use waveform tables." (KB)

/VARIOUS/G-L/KB/Hammer.sid
COMMENT: Also used in an Art Project Studios game named "Oracle 3".

/VARIOUS/G-L/KB/Who_Cares-End_part.sid

         version of the themes I used in the different demo parts... oh my god.
         Everyone liked it but nobody recognized the melodies... gnrf... btw.
         another example what strange effects you can do using osc sync and
         ring modulation (and both TOGETHER!)" (KB)

### Kiss Konrad ##############################################################

/VARIOUS/G-L/Kiss_Konrad/Babysitter.sid
COMMENT: As indicated by its title, this tune covers children songs that were
         popular in Hungary in the late '80s.
  TITLE: Theme of Mouse on Mars [from the cartoon series] (0:13-0:39)
 ARTIST: <?>
  TITLE: Puff, The Magic Dragon (0:41-1:06)
 ARTIST: Peter, Paul & Mary
COMMENT: This song was covered by a Hungarian folk band called "100 Folk
         Celsius" with Hungarian lyrics and became a popular tune amongst
         children there.
  TITLE: Theme to "A Mézga család kalandjai" (1:07-1:36)
 ARTIST: Tamás Deák
COMMENT: Title theme of the Hungarian cartoon series "Adventures of the Mézga
         family", which became a popular cartoon series all over Eastern
         Europe in its time.
  TITLE: Micimackó (1:40-2:36)
 ARTIST: Zsuzsa Koncz & Illés
COMMENT: A Hungarian song about how Winnie, the Pooh (Micimackó in Hungarian)
         feels cold in the winter snowfall.

/VARIOUS/G-L/Kiss_Konrad/Deepspace_Travel.sid
  TITLE: Unreal II - The 2nd Reality [from the PC demo] (1:01-2:34)
 ARTIST: Jonne Valtonen (Purple Motion of Future Crew)
COMMENT: The chord melody is as in one part in the original.

/VARIOUS/G-L/Kiss_Konrad/Neverending_Story.sid
  TITLE: Never Ending Story [from the movie]
 ARTIST: Giorgio Moroder, performed by Limahl

/VARIOUS/G-L/Kiss_Konrad/Tears.sid
  TITLE: Dancing With Tears in My Eyes [from Lament]
 ARTIST: Ultravox

  TITLE: The Clumsies Theme <?> [from the cartoon series]
 ARTIST: <?>

         translation of the Hungarian title of an old Czechoslovakian
         claymation series which had this title tune.

### Luca #####################################################################

/VARIOUS/G-L/Luca/
COMMENT: Older tunes were composed on a Commodore Plus/4 using a specially
         converted version of Future Composer, and then ported back to a
         C64. As the Plus/4 has a limited sound chip, the instruments will
         sound a little flat. The composer recommends that all tunes from 2000
         and beyond should be played using 8580 SID emulation or using a real
         8580 SID. Luca's own comments are indicated by (LC).

/VARIOUS/G-L/Luca/Ah_my_Goddess.sid
  TITLE: My Heart Iidasenai, Your Heart Tashikametai
 ARTIST: Yasuda Takeshi
COMMENT: The tune is the opening theme from anime "Ah My Goddess!" and its
         rough English translation is "My Heart won't let me say, I want to be
         certain of Your Heart".

/VARIOUS/G-L/Luca/Ai_oboeteimasuka.sid
  TITLE: Ai oboeteimasuka
 ARTIST: Kazuhiko Katoo, performed by Lynn Minmay
COMMENT: "Translated from Japanese, the title means "Love, do you remember?".
         "This is the main song of the animation movie ``Superdimensional
         Fortress Macross - Love, do you remember?´´, sung by Lynn Minmay
         during the final battle." (LC)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Luca/Anywhere_is.sid
  TITLE: Anywhere Is [from The Memory of Trees]
 ARTIST: Enya

/VARIOUS/G-L/Luca/Attenti_al_lupo.sid
  TITLE: Attenti al lupo
 ARTIST: Lucio Dalla

/VARIOUS/G-L/Luca/Battery_remix.sid
  TITLE: Spellbound, Tune #1
 ARTIST: Rob Hubbard

/VARIOUS/G-L/Luca/Bloody_bullet.sid
  TITLE: Iron Horse, Tune #1
 ARTIST: David Whittaker

/VARIOUS/G-L/Luca/Book_of_days.sid
  TITLE: Book of Days [from Shepherd Moons]
 ARTIST: Enya
COMMENT: "Completely wrong volume levels here...sorry!" (LC)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Luca/Boy_Band.sid
  TITLE: Boy Band
 ARTIST: Velvet
COMMENT: "I don't really like this pop tune, but it was my torment during
         Summer 2001." (LC)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Luca/Central_Park_Loader_Y2K.sid
  TITLE: Last Ninja 2 - Central Park (loader)
 ARTIST: Matt Gray

/VARIOUS/G-L/Luca/Colla.sid
  TITLE: Colla [from Acido-Acida]
 ARTIST: Prozac+
COMMENT: The title translates from Italian as "Glue". "Although I think it
         refers to...strange kinds of glue..." (LC)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Luca/Dragonball_promo.sid
COMMENT: "This music is covered from the italian spot for the japanese cartoon
         series ``Dragon Ball´´." (LC)

/VARIOUS/G-L/Luca/Galaxy_Express_999.sid
  TITLE: Galaxy Express 999
 ARTIST: Oliver Onions
COMMENT: This song is the Italian title song for the Japanese cartoon series
         "Ginga Tetsudo 999" (translated from Japanese: "Galaxy Express 999")
         It has also been used in a movie with another title, "Fantasy".

         real SID, but try to move Parameter 1 in SIDPLAY to the right." (WR)

         this on the C64. It's one of my last things I've done on the c64."
         (WR)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Nebula/HipHop.sid
COMMENT: "This song I've composed with Soundmaster 3.?? by SoedeSoft (where I
         never found a packer for)."

/VARIOUS/M-R/Nebula/Kiahrella.sid
COMMENT: "Dedicated to my ex-girlfriend Karla" (WR)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Nebula/Many.sid
COMMENT: "I tried to make some classic music, but it sounds more like 'chaotic
         harmonies'" (WR)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Nebula/Monotype.sid
COMMENT: "This tune I've especially composed for a demo by Onslaught Design,
         but I don't know if they did ever release it." (WR)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Nebula/OS_2.sid
COMMENT: "I can't remember why I used this name." (WR)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Nebula/Palmoliv.sid
COMMENT: "Used in the game 'Leisure Suit Leo 2' by Out of Order" (WR)
         for additional Comments see 'Phronk'!

/VARIOUS/M-R/Nebula/Phronk.sid
COMMENT: "Damn, I used Filter $F6 at a very low Freq., but it seems that it
         only sounds good on my SID. Try these Filtersettings in SIDPLAY:
         Parameter 1: <......*>
         Parameter 2: <...*...>
         Parameter 3: <*......> (This is not the default setting!!!)" (WR)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Nebula/Quatechtro.sid
COMMENT: "From around 1:09 it gets out of sync." (WR)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Nebula/Raggy.sid
COMMENT: "Used in the game 'Leisure Suit Leo 2' by Out of Order" (WR)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Nebula/Revolte.sid
COMMENT: "Used in an Intro for the group Hardcore, which recognizes the
         SID-Chip (new or old) and modificates the music, so that it sounds on
         both chips near equal." (WR)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Nebula/Slaughter.sid
COMMENT: "Another (my first and best) Filter-intensive tune that only sounds
         good on the new SID-Chip. Well, try these Filtersetting in SIDPLAY:
         Parameter 1: <......*>
         Parameter 2: <.*.....> (8 clicks from left)
         Parameter 3: <*......> (This is not the default setting!!!)" (WR)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Nebula/T-Rave.sid
COMMENT: "This tune I've used in a release of my FSC-Noter, which should some
         german guys should remember (greets to all)." (WR)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Nebula/Variations.sid
COMMENT: "My very last song I ever made on a Computer (till 98-10-17).
         It was composed on a big Bass-Amp, so play it also on a big one, you
         will miss (=not hear) the deep bass. On SIDPLAY its hard to let the
         Hi-Hat sound like on a real C64, try this:
         - Set fiters to default
         - Move Parameter 2 two clicks from the left side." (WR)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Nebula/Wake_up.sid
COMMENT: "Used in a Toolcollection called 'Toolbase 1' by Shadow, which I coded
         unders the Handle Seesaw Widow (with this I entered the scene.)" (WR)

### Nordic Beat\ #############################################################

### Odi ######################################################################

/VARIOUS/M-R/Odi/
COMMENT: Odi's (Oliver Klee) own comments are denoted by (OK).

/VARIOUS/M-R/Odi/A_Groovy_Night.sid
COMMENT: "Done with the Cyberlogic Sound Studio... made by me and Sascha/MDG!.
         Sascha and I made it a night. Sleep, what's that? By that time, I had
         figured out what number to add to the filter byte to get roughly the
         same sound as with normal filters." (OK)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Odi/Ancient_Property.sid
COMMENT: "Done with the Cyberlogic Sound Studio... made by me and Sascha/MDG!.
         One of my longest tunes -- and one of my best! The first part is
         partly inspired by J.S.Bach and Jeroen Tel, the second part mostly by
         Drax, being rather short (out of inspiration, just up'n'down the blues
         scale). Uptonogood (don't remember the group, sorry) from Australia
         used this music in his mag 'The Link'." (OK)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Odi/Autumn_Beach.sid
COMMENT: "Done with SoedeSoft's SoundMaster." (OK)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Odi/Bachs_Domain.sid
COMMENT: "Done with the Cyberlogic Sound Studio... made by me and Sascha/MDG!.
         Inspired by J.S.Bach again, I composed this piece as another magsound
         for 'Genetic Dreams' by Trinomic Boozeline. Willy/Presence favored
         this piece a lot (he himself liking Bach, too). I chose the name with
         a sidelook to Sascha's piece 'Drax' Domain'. This piece consists of a
         few different parts which I just lined up one after another, as I was
         unable to come up with some interludes." (OK)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Odi/Back_To_The_Future_III.sid
  TITLE: Back to the Future III - Main Title [from the movie]
 ARTIST: Alan Silvestri
COMMENT: "Done with SoedeSoft's SoundMaster.
         This is a remake of the title tune from the game. Hawk had asked me to
         do it." (OK)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Odi/Baroque_Parting.sid
COMMENT: "This tunes had been composed with the full player in mind (an loaded
         into the editor). That player uses a slight de-tuning for voice #2 and
         #3 in order to achieve a fuller sound. In addition, the instruments
         make use of pulse width modification.
         For the 'zero page version' of this piece, I had cut down the player
         to almost nothing in order to get a real short file with as little
         raster time as possible. During that step, I removed the routine for
         the pulse modification and increased the detuning of voice #2 and #3
         instead, resulting in a slightly different (and slightly less nice)
         sound." (OK)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Odi/Baroque_Parting_Zero_Page.sid
COMMENT: "Done with the Cyberlogic Sound Studio... made by me and Sascha/MDG!.
         I wrote this piece to express my feelings about a freshly broken
         relationship with my (former, sigh) girlfriend. As we just had
         analyzed fugues in music class, I wrote a fugue (in c-minor) as well.
         There is a zeropage version of this tune that saves even more
         rastertime and memory." (OK)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Odi/Bass_Fever.sid
COMMENT: "Done with Chris Hülsbeck's Soundmonitor.
         What a shame that I couldn't make a real FAT bassdrum!" (OK)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Odi/Chips_In_Music.sid
COMMENT: "Done with the Cyberlogic Sound Studio... made by me and Sascha/MDG!.
         I originally had planned to write a techno tune (without too much
         success, as you can hear). It's one of my personal favorites." (OK)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Odi/Chords_Of_Endlessness.sid
COMMENT: "Done with SoedeSoft's SoundMaster.
         A magsound for the Alcoholics. I don't know if they actually used it."
         (OK)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Odi/Cool_Is_Fool.sid
COMMENT: "Done with the Cyberlogic Sound Studio... made by me and Sascha/MDG!.
         Out of inspiration for any new music, I was listening to some of my
         old tunes and started to play around with the old 'Groovy Night'. The
         result was this funny little thing. Listen to the portamento with the
         arpeggio (the drop-down)!" (OK)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Odi/Cowboy_Song_2.sid
COMMENT: "Done with SoedeSoft's SoundMaster.
         In the big band I played the trumpet in at that time, we used to play
         'Cowboy Song' by Fred Lipsius. I couldn't exactly play it properly,
         but I like it very much nevertheless. So I took its name for this tune
         (which is the only thing these two pieces have in common)." (OK)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Odi/Dancing_A-Head.sid
COMMENT: "Done with the Cyberlogic Sound Studio... made by me and Sascha/MDG!.
         A funny thing for Trance's diskmag 'A-Head', inspired by the music to
         'Moons' by Drax." (OK)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Odi/Dream_In_Space.sid
COMMENT: "Done with Chris Hülsbeck's Soundmonitor.
         Again a tune my trumpet teacher liked a lot! This tune was publically
         performed (err... played from tape) at a performance of his trumpet
         class I was a pupil in. I was very proud of the drums I had squeezed
         out of little Soundmonitor." (OK)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Odi/Eternal_Sadness.sid
  TITLE: Eternal Sadness
 ARTIST: Traditional
COMMENT: "Done with SoedeSoft's SoundMaster.
         A schoolmate had asked me to arrange this traditional funeral march
         for him. I did my best, but in the end he didn't really like the
         result he came to hear. =:-(" (OK)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Odi/Fuer_Claudia.sid
COMMENT: "Done with Chris Hülsbeck's Soundmonitor.
         I wrote this tune and the previous one on the same afternoon in order
         to impress a girl from dancing class (without success, alas). But at
         least it was fun discussing politics with her on the phone." (OK)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Odi/Genetic_Jazz.sid
COMMENT: "Done with the Cyberlogic Sound Studio... made by me and Sascha/MDG!.
         I wrote this piece for Galen/Trinomic (Trinomic Boozeline) for his mag
         'Genetic Dreams' (my favorite mag) as an apology: I had promised to do
         a few conversions for their demo but didn't get them finished in time.
         So they had to use non-exclusive music." (OK)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Odi/Happy_Birthday.sid
  TITLE: Happy Birthday
 ARTIST: Mildred J. Hill
COMMENT: "Done with the Cyberlogic Sound Studio... made by me and Sascha/MDG!.
         Just a another crappy conversion of this traditional birthday song.
         Too many wrong chords." (OK)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Odi/Happy_Cadaver.sid
COMMENT: "Done with Chris Hülsbeck's Soundmonitor.
         A play on words with the German word for Corpus Christi Day
         ('Fronleichnam')." (OK)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Odi/Henry_Level_1.sid
COMMENT: "Done with the Cyberlogic Sound Studio... made by me and Sascha/MDG!."
         (OK)
(#1)
COMMENT: "This swingy thing was composed for the Jump'n'Run 'Henry' by Peter
         Schwarzfischer (Sky/Masters' Design Group). My first Swing tune for a
         long time (since the 'Underground-Rock'). As it seems, I will still
         compose a different piece for Level 1, as the game has changed its
         mood from funny to more Fantasy-like and gloomy. This music is rather
         old anyway." (OK)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Odi/Jingle_from_Lenor_advert.sid
  TITLE: Lenor advert theme
 ARTIST: <?>
COMMENT: "Done with Future Composer II.
         I didn't like this editor at all (and didn't understand it in full,
         either). An acquaintance from the scene (Doc Holliday or someone from
         Presence ) asked me to convert this music from the 'Lenor' TV ad to
         C64." (OK)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Odi/Laser_Beat.sid
COMMENT: "Done with Chris Hülsbeck's Soundmonitor." (OK)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Odi/Lax_Up.sid
COMMENT: "Done with the Cyberlogic Sound Studio... made by me and Sascha/MDG!.
         Inspired by some tune by Laxity (and with some of its instruments,
         ripped by hand). In English, the 'Lax' Up' is pronounced exactly the
         same as the German translation of 'lick it off' (leck's ab). =:-> "
         (OK)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Odi/Load_The_Power.sid
COMMENT: "Done with SoedeSoft's SoundMaster.
         Hawk/Presence once asked me to compose a short tune for a loader. As
         far as I know, this music has never been used with a loader, though."
         (OK)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Odi/Lords_of_Synthesis.sid
COMMENT: "Done with my first own music player.
         Having read about the great features of Soundmonitor, I got fed up
         with the limits of The Music System (TMS) and the music commands from
         BASIC V7.0. So I wrote my own soundplayer. That thing ate memory and
         rastertime like I drink tea and used a notation similar to the BASIC
         commands. But -- it worked and had cool *filters*! I planned to use it
         in a Snake-like game I was coding (Crowding Crawlers), but the game
         made heavy use of raster interrupts and color effects and thus would
         not work with the music (rastertime ranging from $03 to $80 or so...).
         I never finished the game anyway. But my trumpet teacher liked the
         tune _very_ much! =:-> " (OK)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Odi/Lunatic_Trashcan.sid
COMMENT: "Done with SoedeSoft's SoundMaster." (OK)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Odi/Mega_Put.sid
COMMENT: "Done with Oliver Blasnik's Romuzak." (OK)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Odi/Melt_Your_Brain.sid
  TITLE: Piano Sonata in C (KV 545) (0:00-0:06)
 ARTIST: Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart
COMMENT: "Done with the Cyberlogic Sound Studio... made by me and Sascha/MDG!.
         A 4-time techno tune (my best one of this kind so far) which I wrote
         together with a good friend of mine, Ingo Meyer. While we were
         composing, the speaker box fell off the shelf due to one extremely
         loud bass-kick (no kidding!). This piece contributed to the music
         competition at the Data-Live '93 in Dessau, winning the 2nd place.
         Possibly it would have made the 1st if they had had good big speakers
         instead of that tiny thing in their video beamer! =:-( " (OK)
         Also used in the game "Orb", (c) 1994 Magic Disk 64/CP-Verlag.

/VARIOUS/M-R/Odi/Mothers_Little_Arpeggio.sid
COMMENT: "Done with Oliver Blasnik's Romuzak.
         I came up with the name as my mother didn't like the sound of the
         arpeggios at all." (OK)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Odi/Musical_News.sid
  TITLE: Tagesschau [from the German TV news] (0:00-0:14)
 ARTIST: <?>
COMMENT: "Done with SoedeSoft's SoundMaster.
         Asterix/Victory had asked me to convert the jingle from the German TV
         news 'Tagesschau' for the intro to his diskmag. (In this intro, you
         could see a TV news announcer.) Sascha/DOS/MDG liked this tune very
         much and said to me, grinning: 'I think you've listened to Maniacs of
         Noise far too much!'" (OK)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Odi/Nameless_Horror.sid
COMMENT: "Done with SoedeSoft's SoundMaster.
         What a horror: I couldn't think of any sensible name for this piece of
         music!" (OK)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Odi/Oedipus.sid
COMMENT: "Done with Chris Hülsbeck's Soundmonitor." (OK)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Odi/Peaceful_Beauty.sid
COMMENT: "Done with Oliver Blasnik's Romuzak.
         I wrote this tune and the previous one for Presence, both on the same
         weekend (I obviously felt that I had to become a little more active)."
         (OK)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Odi/Pocket_Funk.sid
COMMENT: "Done with the Cyberlogic Sound Studio... made by me and Sascha/MDG!.
         I merely composed this piece to show that with a special version of my
         CSS player, it is possible to achieve low rastertime of about $10
         (like Music Assembler/Voicetracker, JCH Player V19 or A.K.'s player)."
         (OK)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Odi/Raped_SID.sid
COMMENT: "Done with Oliver Blasnik's Romuzak.
         A guy from Red Sector Inc. asked me to compose a lame-sounding cool
         tune (whatever he might exactly have thought of) for an intro of their
         second group, Ultimate (the section for crap releases)." (OK)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Odi/Rhythm_Of_Life.sid
COMMENT: "Done with Chris Hülsbeck's Soundmonitor." (OK)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Odi/Rock_Around_The_Block.sid
COMMENT: "Done with Chris Hülsbeck's Soundmonitor.
         Again a (rather obvious) play on words. At that time, I used to write
         either Rock'n'Roll style tunes or the usual 'cool' style sidtunes with
         mainly minor scales." (OK)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Odi/Rumour_Land.sid
COMMENT: "Done with the Cyberlogic Sound Studio... made by me and Sascha/MDG!.
         This piece was composed at the Data Live '93 for the party report by
         TRL Designs ('The Real Lunatic'). I had a very nasty back-ache after
         the piece was finished." (OK)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Odi/Session_Tune.sid
COMMENT: "Done with SoedeSoft's SoundMaster.
         I composed this piece at the Security group Meeting in December 1991
         in Mannheim. Security (Demons of Sound [DOS] being part of it) was my
         second group at that time. With this tune, I started a new approach to
         composing on the C64, very much Vibrants-like: start with a groovy
         bassline and write the lead voice last, using a lot of blues scale."
         (OK)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Odi/Sonlasarka_Dunti.sid
COMMENT: "Done with SoedeSoft's SoundMaster.
         This name was supposed to sound Hungarian. My trumpet teacher (who is
         Hungarian) knew better, though. But he liked that tune a lot. I
         composed it for Asterix/Victory as a music for his diskmag." (OK)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Odi/Trance_Introzak.sid
COMMENT: "Done with the Cyberlogic Sound Studio... made by me and Sascha/MDG!.
         Rather out of inspiration...just a little music for the intro by
         Trance." (OK)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Odi/Underground-Rock.sid
COMMENT: "Done with the Cyberlogic Sound Studio... made by me and Sascha/MDG!.
         The first tune to be packed with the packer of the CSS! It wrote it
         for the addymag 'Underground' by Presence." (OK)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Odi/Uranium_Dioxide.sid
COMMENT: "Done with the Cyberlogic Sound Studio... made by me and Sascha/MDG!.
         My first finished attempt to write some techno. I love these harmless
         intros that are composed in an entirely different style than the rest
         of the piece! At the time I composed this piece, we had just learned
         how to write 3- and 4-voiced choir arrangements at school. For
         X-Radical of Nirvana." (OK)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Odi/Vagabonds_Groove.sid
COMMENT: "Done with the Cyberlogic Sound Studio... made by me and Sascha/MDG!.
         Ok, ok, this tune _is_ heavily inspired by the first music from Dutch
         Breeze, composed by Jeroen Tel. I even hand-ripped the snare drum and
         the bass sound from that piece. Anyway, I wrote this tune for
         Tardox/Vagabonds (now a member of Smash Designs) for his demo, a
         contribution to a demo competition by the magazine '64'er'." (OK)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Odi/Wind_of_Change.sid
  TITLE: Wind of Change [from Crazy World]
 ARTIST: Scorpions
COMMENT: "Done with the Cyberlogic Sound Studio... made by me and Sascha/MDG!.
         Doc Holliday/Techno Ind. had asked me to do a conversion of this song
         (by The Scorpions) for a coop-demo against racism." (OK)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Odi/Winter_from_Four_Seasons.sid
  TITLE: Le Quattro Stagioni, Op.8 n.4 "L'Inverno" (Largo)
 ARTIST: Antonio Vivaldi
COMMENT: "Winter" from "The Four Seasons" by Vivaldi. "Done with the Cyberlogic
         Sound Studio... made by me and Sascha/MDG!. A conversion of 'The
         Winter' from Vivaldi's 'Four Seasons', which I ported to the C64 for
         Domino/Security, an old friend on mine." (OK)

### PseudoGrafx ##############################################################

/VARIOUS/M-R/PseudoGrafx/
COMMENT: All comments on PseudoGrafx's tunes are by the author Zdenek
         Eisenhammer (ZE).

/VARIOUS/M-R/PseudoGrafx/Aurora.sid
  TITLE: Aurora [from the Amiga MOD module]
 ARTIST: <?>
COMMENT: "The first version I made on my Atari a few years ago and since I
         love this MOD, I also had to make the C64 version. I was trying to
         make the instruments sound the nearest possible to the original and I
         was quite successful (also because I ripped the trumpet sound from
         some DOS/ADSR tune - check /VARIOUS/A-F/ADSR/DOS/Pursuit.sid).
         Sounds best on a real C64." (ZE)

/VARIOUS/M-R/PseudoGrafx/Close_To_Me.sid
  TITLE: Close To Me [from The Head on the Door]
 ARTIST: The Cure
COMMENT: "This is probably my last tune ever made on C64 - finished in March
         97. I really wonder why I did it in TFX 1.3 although v2.4 was already
         finished..." (ZE)

/VARIOUS/M-R/PseudoGrafx/Fire.sid
  TITLE: Laser Squadron [from the Atari XL/XE game]
 ARTIST: Dieter Bohlen
COMMENT: "A cover of an ATARI XL/XE music from an ugly german game, which was
         really lame although it was quite new ('92 or '93). The music was
         cool anyway :-)." (ZE)

/VARIOUS/M-R/PseudoGrafx/Fonttime.sid
COMMENT: "Made for the font collection in Unreal's tooldisk 'Tooltime'. My
         first original tune (not a cover) on C64 (November 95). Tooltime was
         full of this tune - it was used in nearly all notes on the disk
         because we didn't have any other tunes to use and we didn't want to
         use the ripped ones." (ZE)

/VARIOUS/M-R/PseudoGrafx/Mountain_Bike.sid
  TITLE: Mountain Bike Racer, Tune #1
 ARTIST: Adam Gilmore
COMMENT: This was my first C64 tune made in October 95 and also the first
         tune ever finished in our music editor TFX 1.0. It covers ATARI XL/XE
         version, since I had an 800XE before C64. Anyway the C64 version is
         nearly the same. Maybe if I had known that Adam Gilmore made it
         also on C64, I wouldn't have covered it." (ZE)

/VARIOUS/M-R/PseudoGrafx/Partyzak.sid
COMMENT: "IMHO my worst tune because I was absolutely out of inspiration when
         doing it. I had to finish it during one afternoon since it was a
         tune for our partyreport which was held on one weekend in spring 96
         - and I also had to make a picture for that report on the same day. My
         first tune made in an improved version of TFX - v1.3." (ZE)

/VARIOUS/M-R/PseudoGrafx/Wish_Me_Luck.sid
  TITLE: Wish Me Luck [from the Amiga MOD module]
 ARTIST: Martin Wall (Mantronix/Panorama)
COMMENT: Made for Ray's (Unreal's main coder and HQ) request. It was quite
         an easy work to rewrite it (he recorded the module for me on a tape
         since I didn't have PC yet) - it took me only 1 day and it's nearly
         the same as the original. Made in February 1997. Sounds the best on
         a real C64." (ZE)

### Puterman #################################################################

/VARIOUS/M-R/Puterman/Sit_In_My_Underwear.sid
   NAME: Sit In My Underwear, Drinking Pepsi

         sound better in SIDPlay using the 8580 emulation rather than the 6581.

### Rambones #################################################################

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/
COMMENT: Rambones' (Jan Harries) own comments are denoted by (JH).
         "These C64 songs were made from 28. December 1986 to 12. September
         1988. They were all written in Chris Hülsbeck's Soundmonitor, and some
         in Rockmonitor 2/3 by OPM/Dutch USA-Team, which is a modified version
         of Chris's original editor. Without this editor, I wouldn't be where I
         am today. So once and for all: thank you Chris! for giving me the
         opportunity." (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/1st_Sphere_PSID.sid
COMMENT: "A shitty Rockmon piece I couldn't get any system into. But it has
         some cool things after all." (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Amiga_Noid.sid
COMMENT: "From my last demo of the same name. I was tired of not being able to
         create some decent drums in soundmon, I was tired of my C64 and
         generally this can be heard in the tune. Again I try to make some
         melody with my 'synth' violin to compensate for the lack of rhythm."
         (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Apolloguys.sid
COMMENT: "One of my personal favourites, despite the fact that I used it in an
         apology demo to Zetrex 2005. My good friends Wizz & Kaze demanded me
         to do this demo in order to stop the war. To compensate for my loss of
         face, I filled the screen with my name in sprites, dancing around so
         that you only would remember 2 things after having seen the demo: the
         music and the name RAMBONES. :) What a hoax, Kaze got his software
         from me, and me and TSN visited Wizz every weekend. There's some
         really nice filter in this one, so try a C64." (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Blue_Monday_PSID.sid
  TITLE: Blue Monday
 ARTIST: New Order
COMMENT: "Well, like any other teenager with a C64 and some talent, I just had
         to try. I completely forgot the characteristic drums from the
         original. Nothing more to say, the original will always be the best
         (the one by Anthony Crowther) :-)" (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Broken_Mind.sid
COMMENT: "One of my S.I.D. tunes. S.I.D. was my attempt to conquer the
         softwarehouse like Jeroen and Charles. I did this while learning how
         to use my Amiga." (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Digital_Dream.sid
COMMENT: "Not really a melody, just some of the COOLEST filtereffects you'd
         ever hear. Used for a short contact note. Do try this on a C64." (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Do_The_Mip.sid
COMMENT: "Ha, the joke of my life! Charles Deenen sought musicians who used
         soundmonitor and were into coding. That was me, so I sent him this
         tune, nicely wrapped in an intro. That didn't help any :) By that time
         Noisy Pillars was far over most people's heads anyway." (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Dont_Be_Late.sid
COMMENT: "For what ? Well, the Amiga had given me a 'pop' in the head. This is
         actually a song, but I can't find my text anymore.. damn.." (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Drums_At_Night.sid
COMMENT: "Just trying to see if I can make some 'real' drums... but no.." (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Fairytales.sid
COMMENT: "Another favourite of mine. This was my attempt to imitate some of Tim
         Follin's style. I didn't succeed at that, but I got a wild melody,
         sort of telling a story - that's why the lead is so variable. Actually
         most of my C64 music has an always developing lead, like there's
         endless things to tell." (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/First_Rockmon_PSID.sid
COMMENT: "Just like it says.. my first Rockmon tune. Now I finally had some
         decent drums, leaving a channel free for more effects. The drums plays
         exactly what I could play live on a real drumset :)" (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Freeze_On_PSID.sid
COMMENT: "I really wanted to kick the shit out of the drums, but instead I
         fucked it up by getting to melodious. It get's pretty wild at the end,
         overdrive saw and strange sounds. At 3:30 there's some action." (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Guitar_Flan.sid
COMMENT: "Get this over into your C64 now! :) I thought that Tim Follin's
         guitar in Led Storm was too good, and wondered how the hell he did it.
         So, after working for hours, I found some good sounds and was lucky
         with the filter. This guitar really sounds like a distorted guitar!
         and no samples." (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/I_Like_Choroid.sid
COMMENT: "That's exactly what I did, and I still do. He made some cool sounds,
         and of course I ripped them. I've been searching for you Jonathan for
         like say 8 years, where did you go ? :) I originally put Martin
         Galway's 'Game Over' drums on this tune, but I couldn't convert the
         sampleroutine, and now I don't care, course it was quite noisy anyway.
         :) Just to remind you, try looking in your Choroid dir - and load
         'Choroid's Back!'." (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Indian_Walk.sid
COMMENT: "My 2nd or 3rd tune. It's supposed to sound like it's called :) really
         CRAZY sounds, and I like it! It was missing for several years, because
         the disk was broken, but then I found Hagar's old disks, and he had it
         :) Uoh I like these crazy sounds. C64 preferred." (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Intrusic.sid
COMMENT: "Means: intro-music. :) Not even a melody, just some tap-dancing."
         (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Jarre_Dreams_PSID.sid
COMMENT: "Well, not much Jarre here, but that's the way it goes... This is a
         typical 'Rambones' synth violin yawn yawn long melody. The (in)famous
         sound I refer to was originally ripped from MAD'69 's 'Mixable' demo
         from Scoop. I got stuck with this sound, probably because I played the
         violin for real, and I just couldn't shake it off. :) Again, I
         compensated in the demo, by splatting my name all over the screen."
         (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Like_Galway.sid
COMMENT: "Many have tried, and tried, to imitate Martin's wonderful phasing and
         trance sounds, and we have all failed miserably. :) Anyway, this is
         one of my favourites also, It simply has a bit of atmosphere, maybe
         even a touch of Wizball (which was the general idea). This really
         needs filter! At this point, I had splatted my name all over so many
         demos, that people began to think there was a group called 'The
         Rambones'... I had to write a looong scrolltext, with this music in
         the background, slaying the 'lamers'. :)" (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Maybe_Its_Final.sid
COMMENT: "I was referring to the fact that my Amiga demanded more and more of
         me. So I forgot the melody... The tunes even sounds sad, like I'm
         crying. Actually I think I was..." (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Mixed_Emotions_PSID.sid
COMMENT: "That's exactly what my emotions were as I used this tune in my last
         demo, on the last screen. It was the Dexion-party in 1988. I had
         released Apolloguys the same day, and I had bought my Amiga 500 only 2
         weeks before coming to this party. The first screen featured 'Like
         Galway', and me writing a lot of text about who and what 'Rambones'
         was. The middle screen was the 'Amiga Noid' screen, with a small
         picture of an Amiga, and a scroll telling that TST would soon rule it.
         The last one, with this music, was a 10 point list of things about the
         C64 that bored the hell out of me. Things like colorbars, sprites
         moving in sinus, Hubbard alike drums/routines, all with the same sound
         and generally everything that was in at that time. For me it was sad
         to see a large variety of composers using more or less the same
         routine, leaving the music in a grey state. I admire the sound of Fred
         Gray, Martin Galway, Rob Hubbard, David Whittaker, Ben Daglish and
         Anthony Crowther, and any other programmer that built it all up from
         scratch." (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Multiple_Dreams.sid
COMMENT: "The seed had been planted. After releasing my first music-dedicated
         demo, I had so many new dreams and desires, because now I had finally
         made some music, all by myself. That's kind of the reason for the
         title of this. I don't remember the name, but this piece was inspired
         by a Depeche Mode song." (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Negative_PSID.sid
COMMENT: "I don't know what to say about this... It was just made sometime, and
         never used for anything. Anyway, it has a nice theme I think..." (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Never_Man.sid
COMMENT: "Another attempt to make those pulsedrums work.. but no... :)" (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/No_Mercy_Theme.sid
  TITLE: Mission of Mercy
 ARTIST: Peter Clarke
COMMENT: "A sort of a try to remake a really great tune by Peter Clarke with
         the same name." (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Nu_Er_Den_Sgu_Helt_PSID.sid
COMMENT: "I just wanted to see if I could make a special kind of music that we
         call 'suppe steg og is' here in Denmark. The kind of music you hear at
         family parties, weddings etc. I used it in a special note/greeting
         demo for my contacts, and wrote that it was a Galway tune... Some
         believed me. :)" (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Oceanic.sid
COMMENT: "This needs filter! (C64)... As I saw that Jonathan Dunn continued to
         make music for Ocean, I thought that maybe I had a chance also, so I
         sent this tune to the company. I never got a reply. :) well, I didn't
         really care anyway because I now was using Soundtracker every day, all
         day long. My newfound inspiration: SLL .. :) After having made my
         first few Soundtracker-modules, I sent a demo with some musics and a
         picture to Hewson. They replied: your music is quite good, but we
         cannot accept you as a graphics-artist, the picture lacks all kind of
         inspiration. Arrrghh.... Their music in their games sucked bigtime
         back then..." (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Ode_To_Banana_V1.sid
COMMENT: "Everybody old enough knows the 'Ode To Martin' by MC/Dutch USA-Team.
         One of my good contacts, and a very musical one to was Banana/The
         Electronic Knights. He had already made more than 30 tunes when I
         first laid my hands on Soundmon. I didn't know at all how to use this
         program, but I could hear from Chris' and Banana's music that it
         definitely was the way to go. So I asked Banana for some help. He sent
         me more than 10 handwritten pages, how to type in this bass and use
         the program. So, it was my first tune ever. As on any occasion:
         Banana, if you see this, write to me!" (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Ode_To_Banana_V2.sid
COMMENT: "This is much better, I'd even say good. :) The sounds are Banana's
         'Rammax' sounds. Nothing much to say. I love this tune, hope you do
         to." (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Ode_To_Laxity.sid
COMMENT: "Well, I met Laxity the first time when he visited Wizz, to code some
         demos. He was very into using Rob's routine, and slowly doing his own
         player. In a transition period he had doing this, he tried
         Soundmonitor, and, not to my surprise, of course he was much better
         than I. So, what do you do ? Of course, another 'Ode to...' :) I kinda
         like this, as did he, but there's hardly any bass in it, because I try
         (again) to make some drums.,, One more thing: the sounds were made by
         Laxity. :)" (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Rabies.sid
COMMENT: This tune was first released in "Album of the Year".

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Read-Important_PSID.sid
COMMENT: "Used in a note to my contacts, to say they should please
          not join F.A.S.T. (Federation Against The Supply Team)" (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Resolute.sid
COMMENT: "We are in the final chapter of my C64 days. I was composing / drawing
         / programming / writing, all alone on my final demo: Zound Muzak #4.
         I had just learned FLD, 8-9 months after everybody else, but at least
         I didn't just rip it. I started on several tunes at the same time, to
         try and get them all to sound as they came from one whole, like Mike
         Oldfield does. This was the first one, but I never finished ZM4, I was
         too bored after all." (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Sad_and_Bad.sid
COMMENT: "It got its name after the final save. :) A bended bass does some
         funny work, but that's about it." (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Satellite.sid
COMMENT: "Used in the first of our 2 Satellite demos, this is a genuine piece
         of early techno style. Not much melody, instead some pumping drums."
         (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Scary_Dreams.sid
COMMENT: "Nothing scary here. I think it got the name because of the
         atmosphere. Do go to a C64 with this! The main force in this tune is
         that I use all 3 voices for melody and no stupid drums. It almost
         sounds as if I designed the tune? No I didn't, almost anything just
         came out by itself." (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Shadows_in_Pain.sid
COMMENT: "The bassline was supposed to set a frame for some sixties style, but
         listen what happens later... :) No no, I think this is just a 10 min.
         worksong." (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Sound_Shocker.sid
COMMENT: "A quite quiet and slow tune. this NEEDS filter (C64)!! The sounds and
         the quiet melody is what this is all about. I made it at a visit to
         one of my friends, trying to teach him about using Soundmon. It was
         made in less than half an hour, then I had to go on to another friend.
         I was so busy, driving around on my moped, dumping demos/games, and
         then on to the next. Finally, every evening, I would end up at TSN's
         place, and our democoding-session could begin, and last until it was
         time to go to school... :)" (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Space_Alien.sid
COMMENT: "A crazy tune! Used in another WAR demo. :) First screen of 'Who Said
         War ???'. Remember ? The scroll where I slagged Laxity as hard as I
         could, even though I love him for his wonderful music." (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Sunshine.sid
COMMENT: "Hmmm.. another drum-experiment perhaps... This isn't finished. It's
         hardly a melody. :)" (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/To_A_Z_er.sid
COMMENT: "I made this for one of my favourite contacts: Wallie/Z-Circle. He was
         one of the few who openly said that he liked my tunes, so I made this
         for him. It could have been better. There's some kind of 'View To a
         Kill' theme, over this whole thing... (hint)" (JH)
  TITLE: A View to a Kill [from the movie] (0:31-0:53)
 ARTIST: Duran Duran & John Barry
  TITLE: A View to a Kill [from the movie] (1:25-1:39)
 ARTIST: Duran Duran & John Barry

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Trombones.sid
COMMENT: "Well, a typical 'Rambones' tune. It has some great waves and echos,
         and one more thing: after 1:10 in comes the trombone - it sounds just
         like a real one, and no samples. A wonderful coincidence made by the
         workings of Soundmonitor. Again, the 'Mixable' sound is here." (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Unbeliever.sid
COMMENT: "Just trying to make some long smooth, dark sounds. There's something
         'Rolling' here. :) Or should I say 'Still Rolling'... Hehe, not much
         of a melody." (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Vendetta.sid
COMMENT: "From the demo where I taught Kaze how to rip 'Rainbow Dragon'. It's
         one of those '1 melody in each channel' songs." (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/When_A_Master.sid
COMMENT: "Needs filter (C64). Has a nice rhythm and some great deep sounds. If
         only I could have made a more variable bass... But, you learn as you
         go along. :)" (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Who_Said_War_PSID.sid
COMMENT: "Undefinable 'Rambones' style. Heh... In this demo I totally slagged
         Kaze for being a lousy composer, because he was. Then one day, he made
         'The Force' and his 'New Limits' introtune. Sad that he put that tune
         on an empty screen, when everybody wanted to see the next, the
         unbelievable fullscreen sideborder-scroll with rasters and
         music+samples. If you have his tunes, then try listening to them."
         (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Zound_Muzak_1.sid
COMMENT: "My first 'music only' dedicated demo. Banana had his IBM Music, and I
         wanted my own series. This was it. I made this in a few hours, and had
         to stop myself. I couldn't stop playing! Because I had just discovered
         the 'record' function in Soundmon. It stayed with me for the rest of
         the C64 days; I played the lead in on my brown keyboard." (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Zound_Muzak_2-Part_1.sid
COMMENT: "Another version of 'Sound Shocker'. Better with filter, much better."
         (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Zound_Muzak_2-Part_2.sid
COMMENT: "It's reverse! - was its first name. Listen and hear why. :) One of my
         favourites. At the time I made this, it was the happiest time of all.
         Playing Delta every day, for one purpose and one purpose only: the
         music! Sure we had ripped it, but it just wasn't the same, it never
         will be. Come back Rob!..." (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Zound_Muzak_3_intro_PSID.sid
  TITLE: <?>
 ARTIST: Karsten Obarski
COMMENT: "I covered one of the first MOD's that Karsten Obarski made" (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Zound_Muzak_3_PSID.sid
COMMENT: "Maybe my finest piece. 3 tunes in one module. 2 of them with
         Rockmonitor drums. The tunes somehow fit well together, because they
         use the same sounds. Notice I learned some more bass here. :) And
         banging those drums! The drums in the last tune were kind of snatched
         from a Matt Gray tune... hehe" (JH)

/VARIOUS/M-R/Rambones/Zound_Muzak_IV.sid
COMMENT: "This is just the intro tune to a demo that was never finished. I
         stole Kaze's NL-bass and tried my way. Strange result I think..."
         (JH)

 ARTIST: Vangelis

 ARTIST: Phil Collins

  TITLE: Blue Monday
 ARTIST: New Order

 ARTIST: Depeche Mode

/VARIOUS/M-R/Ray/Everything_Counts_E.sid

### Shogoon ##################################################################

 ARTIST: Marek Bilinski
COMMENT: The title translates from Polish as "Escape from the tropic zone".
         Marek Bilinski was some kind of a Polish J.M.Jarre, and had a string
         of instrumental hits back in the 80's.

         Software.
