### Sidewinder ###############################################################

/VARIOUS/S-Z/Sidewinder/
COMMENT: Tom Roger Skauen's own comments are indicated by (TRS).

/VARIOUS/S-Z/Sidewinder/A_Covertune.sid
  TITLE: Tusker Intro <?>
 ARTIST: Fee
COMMENT: The original is in the HVSC as /DEMOS/Tusker_Intro.sid.
         "This was a desperate attempt of doing a cover of the Tusker_Intro
         tune, as I wanted to use it in a demo. But the version I had of it was
         bugged, and fell out of synch when looping. This isn't ANYTHING close
         to the original version, but... the reason why this one didn't get a
         name, is that I at the time didn't know where the tune came from or
         who made it." (TRS)

/VARIOUS/S-Z/Sidewinder/Airwolf.sid
  TITLE: Airwolf Theme [from the TV series]
 ARTIST: Sylvester Levay

/VARIOUS/S-Z/Sidewinder/Crazy_Labyrinth.sid
COMMENT: "These tunes were originally meant for a game I had in mind, but I
         never got any further than composing the music and I think maybe I had
         the titlescreen of the game coded ;) (whereof the ingame-tune sucks
         and Game Over-tunes and Get Ready-tunes are heavily, HEAVILY inspired
         by other tunes). This tune has never been spread, and it's if I
         remember correctly now, the last C-64 tune I ever made." (TS)
(#1)
   NAME: Ingame
(#2)
   NAME: Main-theme
(#3)
   NAME: Get Ready
(#4)
   NAME: Game Over

/VARIOUS/S-Z/Sidewinder/Elite_loader.sid
  TITLE: Living on Video
 ARTIST: Trans-X
COMMENT: "This is my first SID-tune ever done. It's never been released, so
         this is the first anyone ever hear of this. I must have been 12 or 13
         years while I did this. (I'm at present day 21), so it's becoming
         quite old :)  Inspired by the Elite-loadertune!" (TS)

/VARIOUS/S-Z/Sidewinder/Friends_Forever.sid
COMMENT: This tune was re-released in "Album of the Year".
         "This was infact my first ever released tune, so when Jazzcat got all
         my tunes, I was kinda surprised to find out that he chosed this one
         for ``Album of the Year´´." (TRS)

/VARIOUS/S-Z/Sidewinder/Great_Escape.sid
  TITLE: Theme from The Great Escape [from the movie]
 ARTIST: Elmer Bernstein

/VARIOUS/S-Z/Sidewinder/Love_Sees_No_Color.sid
  TITLE: Living on Video
 ARTIST: Trans-X
COMMENT: "Many people may wonder why this tune is named "Love Sees No Color"
         when the tune's name infact is "Living On Video". Well, this is due to
         the fact I didn't know the tune's name... just what it sounded like,
         and TDS / Fluid told me that the name WAS "Love Sees No Color", and I
         ofcourse trusted him. Shouldn't have done that ;)" (TRS)

/VARIOUS/S-Z/Sidewinder/Maniac_Mansion.sid
  TITLE: Maniac Mansion, Tune #1
 ARTIST: Chris Grigg & David Lawrence

/VARIOUS/S-Z/Sidewinder/Neverending_Story.sid
  TITLE: Never Ending Story [from the movie]
 ARTIST: Giorgio Moroder, performed by Limahl

/VARIOUS/S-Z/Sidewinder/Skilles_Johanne.sid
  TITLE: Skilles Johanne
 ARTIST: Sputnik
COMMENT: "This is a cover of a tune by a Norwegian artist called Sputnik. He is
         a truck-driver, and sings in his spare-time. And he's actually not
         singing 100% clean, and YET he's been releasing HEAPS of albums.
         Mostly bought by really old people. The title translated to English,
         would be something like "Divorcing Johanne". And not surprisingly, the
         tune is about a man who wants to get divorced ;) I do NOT listen to
         such music, the inspiration came from a techno-version of this made on
         Amiga back in 94 I think. :)" (TRS)

/VARIOUS/S-Z/Sidewinder/Top_Gun_Anthem.sid
  TITLE: Top Gun Anthem [from the movie]
 ARTIST: Harold Faltermeyer

  TITLE: Big in Japan [from Forever Young]
 ARTIST: Alphaville

/VARIOUS/S-Z/Simon_Laszlo/Brutal_Child.sid
COMMENT: This SID was made famous by the Nagyon Fatál Error demo. It is a
         mixture of Hungarian and English and is a play on words. "Nagyon"
         means "very" or "very much", while "fatál" (with an accent) means
         "wooden plate" in Hungarian.
  TITLE: Magyar Népmesék (0:00)
 ARTIST: Traditional <?>
COMMENT: Covers the title theme of a Hungarian animated series which featured
         well-known Hungarian folk tales and was aimed at children. The title
         means "Hungarian Folk Tales". The title theme itself might be based on
         a Hungarian folk song.
  TITLE: Boci, boci tarka (1:13)
 ARTIST: Traditional
COMMENT: A children's song well-known in Hungary.

### String ###################################################################

         was composed.

         Dr.Kadzija was ill.

 ARTIST: Michael Davidson

         music.

  TITLE: Blue Monday
 ARTIST: New Order

COMMENT: Dedicated to the band String was in (playing the guitar).

COMMENT: A remix of Kling.sid.

  TITLE: Malbrouk s'en va-t-en guerre (0:00)
 ARTIST: Traditional
COMMENT: an Arab tune that was brought to Europe during the crusades and
         became popular during the french revolution, ever sinced spawned
         many songs, including "For He's a Jolly Good Fellow".
  TITLE: Jingle Bells (1:03)
 ARTIST: James Pierpont

/VARIOUS/S-Z/String/Po_Sumama.sid
COMMENT: Arrangement of a traditional Yugoslavian song from the 2nd WW.

COMMENT: First tune String made in Music Assembler.

/VARIOUS/S-Z/String/Prva_Muzika.sid
COMMENT: The first tune made by String.

  TITLE: <?>
 ARTIST: Riblja Corba
COMMENT: Cover of a song from a very famous Yugoslavian rock-band.
         "Riblja Corba" translates as "Fish Soup".

COMMENT: Another remix of a Serbian orthodox church hymn.

COMMENT: Cover of a Serbian church hymn.

         this part. I wonder why, it´s so easy to get in... ;-)" (AR)

### Top Secret ###############################################################

/VARIOUS/S-Z/Top_Secret/
COMMENT: All Rastislav Smutný's comments are denoted by (RS).

/VARIOUS/S-Z/Top_Secret/Another_Fantasy.sid
COMMENT: "The tune was to be used in the game "Panta Rei", but unfortunately
         the project never got finished." (RS)

/VARIOUS/S-Z/Top_Secret/CCN_Was_Born.sid
COMMENT: "CCN (Czechoslovak Commodore Net) was a bunch of several local C64
         groups. The tune was used in a poor anonymous intro." (RS)

/VARIOUS/S-Z/Top_Secret/Ecstasy_PSID.sid
COMMENT: "The very first tune I have ever composed (hence the name ;-)." (RS)

/VARIOUS/S-Z/Top_Secret/Fantasy.sid
COMMENT: Later used in the game "Brain Spasm", (c) 1994 Game On/CP-Verlag.
         "The tune was to be used in the game "Panta Rei", but unfortunately
         the project never got finished." (RS)

/VARIOUS/S-Z/Top_Secret/Flyless_Rape.sid
  TITLE: Rape
 ARTIST: Rastislav Smutný (Top Secret)
COMMENT: "It was a game designer's idea to cut off 'buzz' which you may hear
         at the very beginning of the original track (hence the name). After
         all he did not use nor original neither this abridged version." (RS)

/VARIOUS/S-Z/Top_Secret/High-way.sid
COMMENT: "The tune was used in a Hungarian demo but someone liked the music
         so much that he put his very own credits therein." (RS)

/VARIOUS/S-Z/Top_Secret/Niagara_Memories.sid
  TITLE: Pendant que les champs brulent [from Religion]
 ARTIST: Niagara
COMMENT: "The original title could be (very roughly) translated as 'While the
         fields burn'. Anyway this is not a cover, the song just inspired me
         so much (hence the name)..." (RS)

/VARIOUS/S-Z/Top_Secret/Panta_Rei_Theme_Game_Over.sid
COMMENT: "This 'jingle' was to be used in the game "Panta Rei", but
         unfortunately the project never got finished." (RS)

/VARIOUS/S-Z/Top_Secret/Panta_Rei_Theme_Level_OK.sid
COMMENT: Later used in the game "Brain Spasm", (c) 1994 Game On/CP-Verlag.
         "This 'jingle' was to be used in the game "Panta Rei", but
         unfortunately the project never got finished." (RS)

/VARIOUS/S-Z/Top_Secret/Rush-Hours.sid
COMMENT: Later used in the game "Vision", (c) 1997 64'er/Magna Media.

/VARIOUS/S-Z/Top_Secret/Sex_Fe_m_ale.sid
  TITLE: Sex: Female
 ARTIST: Rastislav Smutný (Top Secret)
COMMENT: "Probably my most famous composition surely deserved to be rearranged
         and slightly modified one day..." (RS)

/VARIOUS/S-Z/Top_Secret/Sex_Female.sid
COMMENT: Later used in the game "Vision", (c) 1997 64'er/Magna Media.
         "Also used in the game "Newcomer" (c) 2001 Cinematic Intuitive
         Dynamix." (RS)

/VARIOUS/S-Z/Top_Secret/Simple_3_2.sid
  TITLE: Simple One
 ARTIST: Rastislav Smutný (Top Secret)
COMMENT: "3 divided by 2 makes 1.5 right? And 1.5 is definitely more than 1.
         Got the picture?" (RS)

/VARIOUS/S-Z/Top_Secret/Simple_One.sid
COMMENT: Later used in the game "Brain Spasm", (c) 1994 Game On/CP-Verlag.

/VARIOUS/S-Z/Top_Secret/T-Tris_Theme_Game_Music.sid
COMMENT: "The tune was to be used in the game "T-Tris" (Tetris clone), but
         unfortunately the project never got finished (beta preview)." (RS)

/VARIOUS/S-Z/Top_Secret/T-Tris_Theme_High_Score.sid

         unfortunately the project never got finished (beta preview)." (RS)

### Trident ##################################################################

/VARIOUS/S-Z/Trident/
COMMENT: Adam Dunkels' own comments indicated by (AD).

/VARIOUS/S-Z/Trident/Acrise.sid
COMMENT: This tune was exclusively made for "Album of the Year".

/VARIOUS/S-Z/Trident/Contrast.sid
COMMENT: "Contrast was originally made for the group Contrast managed by David
         Weinehall (Tao/Triad), hence the name." (AD)

/VARIOUS/S-Z/Trident/Edvin.sid
COMMENT: "Made for Edvin Zetterberg (VDK/Fairlight), hence the name." (AD)

/VARIOUS/S-Z/Trident/Fugue_in_g-minor.sid
  TITLE: Fugue in G Minor
 ARTIST: Johann Sebastian Bach
COMMENT: Won first place at the Assembly '97 music competition.

/VARIOUS/S-Z/Trident/G-Anx.sid
(#1)
COMMENT: "Heavily inspired by the Swedish ultra-speed-underground-hardcore band
         G-Anx." (AD)
(#2)
COMMENT: "Cover of some song I've heard in some intro, some time. Reyn
         Ouwehand??" (AD)

/VARIOUS/S-Z/Trident/Happy_Friday.sid
COMMENT: "Composed on one particularly happy Friday." (AD)

/VARIOUS/S-Z/Trident/Into_Oblivion.sid
COMMENT: Only Trident made this tune, it was falsly credited as a co-op tune
         between Trident and Stellan Andersson (Dane).
         "The reason for his name being in the sid was that the tune was in
         some music competition on a party. Due to their rules the composer had
         to attend the party, and since only Stellan was there, we had to
         pretend that he was a co-composer." (AD)

/VARIOUS/S-Z/Trident/Phonophobia.sid
COMMENT: "Named after the famous EP 'Phonophobia' by the Brittish band Extreme
         Noise Terror. This tune does not, however, have any other connection
         to the band." (AD)

/VARIOUS/S-Z/Trident/Sister_Daylight.sid
COMMENT: This tune was exclusively made for "Album of the Year".

/VARIOUS/S-Z/Trident/Under_the_Sun.sid
  TITLE: Under the Sun (0:00-1:10)
 ARTIST: Anti-Cimex

/VARIOUS/S-Z/Trident/Wastelands.sid
  TITLE: God Rest Ye Merry Gentlemen (1:40-2:10)
 ARTIST: Traditional
COMMENT: English carol.

/VARIOUS/S-Z/Trident/Wisdom.sid
  TITLE: Fishing Junks at Sunset [from Concerts in China] (0:00-0:14)
 ARTIST: Jean Michel Jarre

/VARIOUS/S-Z/Trident/Wonderflow.sid
COMMENT: "Main theme inspired by '20th Century Egyptian' by Wonderflow (hence
         the name)." (AD)

/VARIOUS/S-Z/Vip/Fairad.sid
(#1)
 AUTHOR: Vincent Merken (Vip)
(#2)
 AUTHOR: Vincent Merken (Vip)
(#3)
 AUTHOR: Vincent Merken (Vip)
(#4)
 AUTHOR: Vincent Merken (Vip)
  TITLE: Red October
 ARTIST: Linus Walleij (King Fisher)
(#5)
   NAME: Enfairlightenment
 AUTHOR: Warren Pilkington (Waz)
  TITLE: Enlightenment: Druid II, Tune #3
 ARTIST: David M. Hanlon
COMMENT: "Well, seeing as this tune was so well used for the FairLight
         crack intro, I did a remake for the intro remake." (WP)
(#6)
   NAME: Enfairlightenment II
 AUTHOR: Warren Pilkington (Waz)
  TITLE: Enlightenment: Druid II, Tune #3
 ARTIST: David M. Hanlon
COMMENT: "More loosely based, more fantasy inspired midway." (WP)
(#7)
   NAME: Vem er Emmy Köhler?
 AUTHOR: Warren Pilkington (Waz)
  TITLE: Nu Tändas Tusen Juleljus
 ARTIST: Emmy Köhler
COMMENT: "Seeing as Avalon was a member of FairLight, I thought it'd be
         a nice idea to cover one of his C64 tunes.  I really loved this
         one and fitted perfectly into an intro." (WP)
(#8)
   NAME: Gray Matter of Doom
 AUTHOR: Warren Pilkington (Waz)
COMMENT: "An oldskool type Matt Gray soundalike, to imagine the time when
         crack intros used old ripped game themes." (WP)
(#9)
   NAME: The End, Or Is It?
 AUTHOR: Warren Pilkington (Waz)
COMMENT: "Really punchy.  As we were running out of sequences in JCH
         Editor, I had to compromise slightly and use a few sequences
         from an earlier tune.  It worked well though as it also meant
         back to oldskool style of composers ripping ideas off each
         other ;)." (WP)

/VARIOUS/S-Z/Vip/Fungus.sid
  TITLE: Test Drive, Tune #2 (0:00-0:23)
 ARTIST: Patrick Payne
COMMENT: Only bassline covered.

/VARIOUS/S-Z/Vip/Love.sid
  TITLE: Physical Presence [from the Amiga MOD module]
 ARTIST: Jogeir Liljedahl
COMMENT: This SID won The Party 99 music competition.

  TITLE: Maniac Mansion, Tune #1
 ARTIST: Chris Grigg & David Lawrence

### Vincent Voois ############################################################

/VARIOUS/S-Z/Voois_Vincent/
COMMENT: The LNO handle he used for some of his tunes stands for Lethal Noise
         Operator.

/VARIOUS/S-Z/Voois_Vincent/Axel_F_Extended_Mix.sid
  TITLE: Axel F [from the movie Beverly Hills Cop]
 ARTIST: Harold Faltermeyer
COMMENT: "Every musician probably was demanded to have his/her version of
         Axel-F. I just decided to try the extended mix which was found on the
         b-side of the single (i believe)." (VV)

/VARIOUS/S-Z/Voois_Vincent/Because_of_Love.sid
  TITLE: Because of Love
 ARTIST: Janet Jackson

/VARIOUS/S-Z/Voois_Vincent/Country_Song.sid
COMMENT: "The country song was a part of some mega medley type of song, when my
         friends heard this part they started to laugh and demanded from me to
         subtract this part from the whole medley since the rest around it
         wasn't very interesting. So I did. I did a remake of this song on
         Amiga and PC (FM-based Screamtracker mod that is!)" (VV)

/VARIOUS/S-Z/Voois_Vincent/Ducktales.sid
COMMENT: "This was some kind of personal bet to a friend of mine who found the
         title song of the Ducktales game awesome. I bet i could make a better
         version. I won a power cartridge." (VV)

/VARIOUS/S-Z/Voois_Vincent/Endtune.sid
  TITLE: Golden Axe, Tune #1 (1:20-1:35)
 ARTIST: Jeroen Tel

/VARIOUS/S-Z/Voois_Vincent/Foofur.sid
COMMENT: "Some title-song ripped down from a cartoon about a blue dog.
         Not a 100% rip." (VV)

/VARIOUS/S-Z/Voois_Vincent/Game_Level_1.sid
COMMENT: "It belongs to the main title song which was used in Visual Delight 1,
         along with other parts. It was actually meant for a game but was never
         used." (VV)

/VARIOUS/S-Z/Voois_Vincent/Game_Level_2.sid
COMMENT: "It belongs to the main title song which was used in Visual Delight 1,
         along with other parts. It was actually meant for a game but was never
         used." (VV)

/VARIOUS/S-Z/Voois_Vincent/Game_Level_3.sid

/VARIOUS/S-Z/Voois_Vincent/Lethal_Noise_Operator_2.sid
COMMENT: "One of the first songs I seriously composed in Heatcliff's routine. I
         hated hard-code composing but for all the effects it had and the
         capabilities which were implemented, there was no better musicroutine
         and I tried a few others from Falco Paul, JCH, Laxity but most of them
         were pale routines which lacked intresting features." (VV)

/VARIOUS/S-Z/Voois_Vincent/Lets_Climb_Up.sid
COMMENT: "This is the Music Assembler version." (VV)

         convert the Mus-Ass song to his routine. Not that it has been used but
         it is converted anyway." (VV)

### Waz ######################################################################

/VARIOUS/S-Z/Waz/
COMMENT: For the full Zaw Productions tune info, read the Zaw Guide at
         http://home.freeuk.net/wazzaw/zawproductions/zawguide.html
         All Warren's comments are indicated by (WP).

/VARIOUS/S-Z/Waz/12_Days_Of_Christmas.sid
  TITLE: The Twelve Days of Christmas
 ARTIST: Traditional

  TITLE: 92 Degrees [from The Pop Will Eat Itself Cure For Sanity]
 ARTIST: Pop Will Eat Itself

/VARIOUS/S-Z/Waz/Aa_4_05_Preview_Version.sid
COMMENT: "An ambient tune I never finished because Kenz and I decided it didn't
         suit the Kenzterview." (WP)

/VARIOUS/S-Z/Waz/Adventures_Of_Flopsy.sid
COMMENT: "A tune that was originally written for my Quadraped Tearaways 2 demo,
         but I rejected it due to its quite happy mood not suiting the rest of
         the tunes I wrote." (WP)

/VARIOUS/S-Z/Waz/Album_Sampler.sid
COMMENT: "The two tunes in this file are 7 inch edit versions of tracks later
         to appear on the 'Quadraped Tearaways' album demo." (WP)

/VARIOUS/S-Z/Waz/Always_With_You.sid
COMMENT: "An exclusive tune I did for News Press disk magazine, inspired by the
         fact that loved ones such as girlfriends or family pets are always
         with you in your mind even if you aren't actually with them. It's
         quite a nice plucked instrument on the C64 too, which took me ages to
         get right!" (WP)

/VARIOUS/S-Z/Waz/Baby_Penguins_Adventure.sid
COMMENT: "I have a picture in my room which is a mother and father penguin,
         with its cute baby one in the middle. I just imagined the baby one
         having a little adventure, much like the cartoon series Pingu." (WP)

         there you have it - Digital Acid remixed." (WP)

 ARTIST: Nine Inch Nails

/VARIOUS/S-Z/Waz/Football_Tunes.sid
COMMENT: "This demo originally had references to my favourite club Manchester
         City but when I heard Thalamus were planning an Arsenal FC licence I
         changed the titles of tunes #2 and #7 to resemble Arsenal players or
         chants and sent it off to Dave Birch. I was going to do the music for
         that game but the project never saw the light of day!" (WP)
(#1)
  TITLE: The Stars and Stripes Forever
 ARTIST: John Philip Sousa
COMMENT: Often known to sports fans as "Here We Go".
(#2)
  TITLE: Land Of Hope And Glory [from Pomp and Circumstance March No.1]
 ARTIST: Edward Elgar (music), A.C. Benson (lyrics)
(#3)
  TITLE: You're Going To Get Your F*****g Head Kicked In
 ARTIST: Traditional <?>
COMMENT: "A hooligan chant that surfaced rather nastily in the 80's." (WP)
(#4)
  TITLE: Blue Moon
 ARTIST: The Marcels
(#5)
  TITLE: When the Saints Go Marching In
 ARTIST: Traditional
COMMENT: American folk song. Sung by British football fans at matches.
(#6)
  TITLE: Saint And Greavsie
 ARTIST: <?>
COMMENT: The theme tune to the UK ITV TV show. Also was the tune for their 1986
         World Cup coverage.
(#7)
  TITLE: Peter Reid (He's Got No Hair But We Don't Care)
 ARTIST: <?>
COMMENT: "Refers to the ex-Man City manager and his lack of hair, a lot of
         people substitute this for their almost token balding player." (WP)
(#8)
  TITLE: Bread of Heaven
 ARTIST: Peter Williams
COMMENT: This Welsh hymn is the basis for many a football chant.
(#9)
  TITLE: In Your Liverpool Slums
 ARTIST: <?>

/VARIOUS/S-Z/Waz/Gigantic.sid
  TITLE: Gigantic [from Surfer Rosa]
 ARTIST: Pixies

/VARIOUS/S-Z/Waz/Grandpa_Pacman.sid
COMMENT: "I was asked by a PC game programmer to do the music for the game. I
         composed it all on my C64, transferred it to SIDPlay, then the author
         converted the tracks to MIDI for use in the final version. Tunes #11
         and #12 were not used in the game. Shame, cos I tried to sound a
         little like Bjerregaard's jazz vibes in #12."(WP)
(#1)
  TITLE: Pacland (arcade music)
 ARTIST: <?>
COMMENT: Cover of the Pacland arcade music. Which is itself a cover of the
         theme of the Pac-Man cartoon.
(#3)
  TITLE: Jingle Bells
 ARTIST: James Pierpont
(#7)
  TITLE: Rush Hour [from Fur]
 ARTIST: Jane Wiedlin
(#11)
  TITLE: Happy Birthday
 ARTIST: Mildred J. Hill

 ARTIST: John Carpenter

  TITLE: Turn It Up [from the movie Who's That Girl]
 ARTIST: Michael Davidson
COMMENT: "I based this on JCH's classic "Hitsong" which featured in many a demo
         and crack intro. I did a C64 and XM verson at the same time, and was
         quite an experiment in the end." (WP)

  TITLE: Hope in a Nuclear World

         extended version for his Graphic Adventure Game 'Retaliation' which I
         did. His band of the same name of the game also did this tune
         frequently as a jam as part of their set." (WP)

         Radcliffe Interview', but the original demo was never released. The
         plan was to have the demo and interview as part of an extra on the
         disk version of Creatures 2 by Thalamus, but John and Steve Rowlands
         rejected the idea." (WP)

/VARIOUS/S-Z/Waz/Insectophobia.sid
COMMENT: "My first game commission that was actually released." (WP)

/VARIOUS/S-Z/Waz/Pacman-esque.sid
COMMENT: "Tunes released 1997, game not finished! Another game commission for
         ANOTHER Pacman type game. I called the collection 'Pacmanesque' as the
         author hadn't told me a title for the game as yet. They are definitely
         being used in his game - and I might end up doing some more tunes for
         it as yet." (WP)
(#1)

 ARTIST: Steve Rowlands

         do!) was done for a Pacman clone Pacrage. However, the main
         programmer's C64 broke and so it never saw the light of day." (WP)

         though!" (WP)

  TITLE: The Running Man [from the movie]
 ARTIST: Harold Faltermeyer

/VARIOUS/S-Z/Waz/Sadness_of_Text.sid
COMMENT: "My experimental entry for the Mekka Symposium 2002 music competition.
         I had an idea in my head to make the C64 sound like those annoying as
         hell Nokia default ringtones, and made the tune around that.
         Unfortunately I could only achieve this with combined waveform $61 on
         the 6581, so the 8580 will play this wrong - in fact, you really need
         a real C64 or HardSID to hear it as I intended it.  See if you can
         spot the ringtones I based the idea on." (WP)

/VARIOUS/S-Z/Waz/Santa_Claus_Is_Coming.sid

 ARTIST: J. Fred. Coots

/VARIOUS/S-Z/Waz/Trimetophrim_Ibuprofen.sid
COMMENT: "I was suffering with a urine infection at the time I composed this
         (just don't get one folks - it's awful). The title refers to two drugs
         I was prescribed, one of which actually sent me delirious. I guess
         this tune was my calming influence around all that." (WP)

/VARIOUS/S-Z/Waz/Vehicular_Hell.sid
COMMENT: "A little protest song I wrote about people who use the car for
         every little journey, even when it's unnecessary, and how those
         of us who are environmentally friendly have to suffer breathing
         their car fumes.  When we're all complaining about global warming
         in the future, I just hope they can live with what they've done.
         In the meantime, I'll stick to public transport." (WP)

/VARIOUS/S-Z/Waz/What_Time_Is_Love.sid

 ARTIST: KLF

  TITLE: What Time Is Love?
 ARTIST: KLF

/VARIOUS/S-Z/Waz/Wind.sid
COMMENT: "This was a bit different! I was stuck in the house with a cold wind
         blowing away, which inspired me to have the whole of the tune with a
         wind howling noise in the background, with the rest of the slighly
         uneasy tune playing on. For News Press Issue #20." (WP)

### MARTIN WALKER ############################################################

/Walker_Martin/Aggressor_Theme.sid
COMMENT: Also used in the game 'Revolution' (c) 1990 Commodore Format.

/Walker_Martin/Altered_Beast.sid
(#1)
  TITLE: Rise from Your Grave (Round 1) [from the arcade game Altered Beast]
 ARTIST: SEGA Sound Team
(#2)
  TITLE: <?> (Round Up) [from the arcade game Altered Beast]
 ARTIST: SEGA Sound Team
(#3)
  TITLE: Altered Beast (Boss) [from the arcade game Altered Beast]
 ARTIST: SEGA Sound Team
(#4)
  TITLE: Gaum-Hammer (Boss Theme) [from the arcade game Altered Beast]
 ARTIST: SEGA Sound Team
(#5)
  TITLE: Closed in upon Me (Round 2) [from the arcade game Altered Beast]
 ARTIST: SEGA Sound Team
(#6)
  TITLE: I'll be Back (Round 3) [from the arcade game Altered Beast]
 ARTIST: SEGA Sound Team

/Walker_Martin/Dragon_Breed_PSID.sid
COMMENT: All the tunes cover the arcade version by Irem.

/Walker_Martin/Galaxy_Force_II.sid
COMMENT: This could be a cover of the arcade version.

/Walker_Martin/Indiana_Jones_Fate_of_Atla.sid
  TITLE: Theme from The Raiders of the Lost Ark [from the movie]
 ARTIST: John Williams

/Walker_Martin/Ninja_Spirit.sid
COMMENT: Covers the arcade version.

/Walker_Martin/Rodland.sid
COMMENT: All tunes come from the arcade version of the game.

/Walker_Martin/Speedball_2.sid
  TITLE: SpeedBall 2 [from the Amiga game]
 ARTIST: Nation XII

/Walker_Martin/Walkers_Warbles.sid
COMMENT: "Walker's Warbles" was a Martin Walker music demo which came as a free
         giveaway with the disk version of "Armalyte" by Thalamus (which MW did
         the music for.) Tune 3 is an early version of what would eventually be
         used in the game "Dominion" bundled on a Zzap! 64 covertape in 1990,
         and tune 4 is an early version of the "Aggressor Theme". The final
         version of this (and the one which Revolution uses) is the one on MW's
         "Zzap! 64 Music Demo" which appeared on Zzap 64's June 1989 covermount
         cassette. (Comment by Warren Pilkington)
(#4)
COMMENT: This tune was also used in a game called Revolution (written by Simon
         Pick). The game was never released, but featured on Commodore Format
         magazine's powerpack (tape) number one.

(#3)
COMMENT: This is a medley of some of the other tunes
(#18)

/Whittaker_David/Elektra_Glide.sid
  TITLE: Elektra Glide
 ARTIST: Yakao
COMMENT: "The music to Elektraglide was advertised as being composed by a
         professional musician, but that musician wasn't Whittaker: it was a
         session musician for the Gil Scott Herron band who went under the
         pseudonym Yakao. Whittaker just covered the Atari version for the C64
         version" (Info from Chris Abbott)

### JOACHIM WIJNHOVEN ########################################################

/Wijnhoven_Joachim/
COMMENT: All comments by Joachim Wijnhoven are marked with (JW).

/Wijnhoven_Joachim/Action_Biker_Remix.sid
  TITLE: Action Biker, Tune #1
 ARTIST: Rob Hubbard
COMMENT: "This is a remix from Rob Hubbard's Action Biker main theme (#1) from
         the year 1985! (c) Mastertronic. Listen to the original and hear the
         difference! I first typed over the notes (bass + lead) from a Music
         Assembler example tune. Not using the ugly percussion track. The
         chords are typed over from a Midi file called Biker. (Lazy me eh?!).
         Maybe this will not be necessary in future because there is a Midi to
         Mod program and buddy Roland Hermans has made a Mod to Sid program.
         I'm not quite happy with this tune because of the weak 2 notes
         arpeggio part (from 1:14 to 1:50). I made the volume of this arpeggio
         part a bit softer so it becomes a bit less annoying. Maybe I will
         improve this tune sometime. Same presets used as in Rolfie Title
         Remix. Typing over the notes took some amount of time (I always work
         slowly!). I used too many sequences in the 2nd track (it can only
         handle 128). So Roland Hermans "packed" several sequences into only a
         few so the player can handle them. This is the 2nd tune for mainly
         Polish based group Axelerate. Tune is played at CIA 1 Timer A (PAL)
         because we wanted another speed than a normal one. Tune has nice
         ending, don't you agree? Hope you like it!" (JW)

/Wijnhoven_Joachim/Als_de_sterre.sid
   NAME: Als de sterre dao baove straole
COMMENT: "The demo in which this sound was spread contained the full lyrics of
         the song written in South Dutch dialect. This tune consists of a
         double lead to get a sort of echo effect. The reason why I made this
         song: In the south of Holland we celibrate Carnival each year around
         the end of February and because I live in a provence of Southern
         Holland called Limburg I decided to make one of the best Carnival
         songs on the C64! During Carnival everyone dresses up in some strange
         costume and goes into pubs to party and of course drink a lot of beer.
         The title of the song translated into English is: When the stars are
         shining up there. Written in waltz tempo. Hope you like it." (JW)

/Wijnhoven_Joachim/Arabian_Nights.sid
COMMENT: "Demo containing this tune had a nice "gadget" enclosed. The drive led
         reacted on 1 of the tracks. (Ofcourse coded by Roland Hermans). I only
         just came up with the title of this song after Roland changed
         something in the presets (instruments) which gave it an Arabian touch.
         Ok I think. Composed on piano." (JW)

/Wijnhoven_Joachim/Beast_III_Title.sid
  TITLE: Shadow of the Beast III [from the Amiga game]
 ARTIST: Tim & Lee Wright
COMMENT: "Of course I had to squeeze the Amiga 4 tracks in to c64's 3. But the
         tune uses 2 tracks for the part which isn't the lead or bass. How do
         you call that part anyway? (backing?) While going through old Amiga
         500 games with buddy Roland (we were looking through because we are
         planning a c64 demo consisting converted Amiga pics in FLI-Interlace)
         we stumbled upon this tune. I like it very much so I tried if I could
         rip it with my Datel Electronics' Amiga Action Replay MK III. I froze
         the game and typed in tracker. And golly yes! The cartridge found the
         tune and I saved it to disc and loaded it in my Protracker soundtool.
         Together with Roland I converted it. (He works much quicker than me).
         We are planning to do more conversions. After this conversion Roland
         made a program to convert from MOD to SID, right into my player as
         I said in Action Biker Remix STIL text. But now it even converts
         arpeggios! The presets are: bass from Psycho Pigs UXB. Flute resembles
         Amiga lead sample instrument but has a little waveform 41 tick at
         the beginning and is made by Roland. Other preset is from Henning
         Rokling's Henning_Rokling-02.sid which is used in demo Wild At Heart.
         We first made an arpeggio sound consisting of two different c notes
         but it didn't work out well. In beginning of the tune you can hear a
         build up of decay and sustain in this preset. To get this effect we
         had to make 4 presets just changing the decay and sustain from 2 to 8.
         The wave on effects on bass and Rokling preset make it sound ok on
         c64. Often this effect is used to substitute normal hi hat sounds.
         This ditty is one of my favourite tunes!" (JW)

/Wijnhoven_Joachim/Dream_Away.sid
COMMENT: "This is a short zax consisting of a Police "Every breath you take"
         alike background. Was never released and never completely finished."
         (JW)

/Wijnhoven_Joachim/Forester.sid
COMMENT: "Game was made (like Tough Guys) by Ramon (BB) van de Laar. And it's
         about a forester who has to paint the brown leaves green again
         avoiding EVIL forest animals. It was a real pain in the ass to play
         but was awarded as one of the best games in '92.
         My pally Roland Hermans (ex-Einstein/RGJ/Smidas from ATG (Actual
         Trading Generation) always helped me with the technical bits of C64
         music like players and presets etc. Some presets throughout this game
         music are from Johannes Bjerregaard's Flimbo's Quest. There's one I
         used as lead, bass and as arpeggio (chords)." (JW)
(#1)
COMMENT: "This is the congratulations tune consisting a Follin like melody row
         of fast notes from a demo (forgot which one). The filter lead in the
         beginning is from Jeroen Tel's Myth tune 3. As you can hear I very
         much like to leave the bass away at the end of "saxes" to get a nice
         "echo" effect." (JW)
(#2)
COMMENT: "This level tune 1, a 2-voice zax made in a simple march tempo. The
         other track was used as sound-fx track. I thought about putting in a
         3rd optional drum track or extra lead track but this was thought to be
         not necessary." (JW)
(#3)
COMMENT: "This is the second level zax, also 2-voiced. Bit more cheerful than
         the 1st level zax. Bits of the melody popped into my mind when I was
         cycling home from school." (JW)
(#4)
  TITLE: Canon in D major
 ARTIST: Johann Pachelbel
COMMENT: "I used a Tim Follin bass from Psycho Pigs UXB tune 1. The harmonica
         is from Follin's Black Lamp tune 1." (JW)
(#5)
COMMENT: "This is the game over tune. First made in Dutch USA team's Music
         Assembler. I made this tune not knowing what it would become. But it
         fits its purpose very nicely I think." (JW)
(#6)
COMMENT: "This is the high score tune. Before Forester this sound was published
         (slightly different from this one) as "Ode to Junior". Junior was a
         cat that we had at my elderly home. Was, because he's now in cat's
         heaven. Tune was made in a period I didn't know how to make use of
         arpeggio's (chord substitutes). It's still ok, I guess." (JW)
(#7)
COMMENT: "This is the bonus level tune. It's made a bit faster than the level
         tunes to get that hectic feel. Funny is the extreme fast part starting
         from (1:41) which may make the game even more difficult to play if you
         let yourself be influenced by the sound." (JW)
(#8)
  TITLE: Kwik Snax, Tune #6
 ARTIST: <?>
COMMENT: "This is the end of level zax. Without knowing I unintentionally
         somewhat copied tune 6 from Codemasters' Kwik Snax. I used 2 tracks
         for the lead to get that sort of echo stuff in." (JW)

/Wijnhoven_Joachim/Infinity.sid
  TITLE: Infinity
 ARTIST: Guru Josh
COMMENT: "If I had the knowledge I now have when I made this piece I certainly
         would have put in some chords and combined the drums and bass in one
         track like Moz(IC)Art did (the best version on the C64). Reyn
         Ouwehand's version also has its moments. Though I think my version has
         the most resembling saxophone sound on this compy." (JW)

/Wijnhoven_Joachim/Koyaanisqatsi.sid
  TITLE: Koyaanisqatsi [from the movie]
 ARTIST: Philip Glass
COMMENT: "Glass' own style is called "minimalistic music". I got the music on
         tape from pally Paultje (M0k) Kessels, I thought it was brill and
         converted it into Dutch USA team's Music Assembler. Bass is nice,
         original MA drums are awful." (JW)

/Wijnhoven_Joachim/Linko_PSID.sid
COMMENT: "This game was a conversion of a popular word game on tv in Holland
         and even was sometime in Germany on the telly in which you get one
         letter of the 5 or 6 and have to guess which word it is, roughly said.
         It's been on the Dutch telly for years and years now, and still is
         very popular. Game was coded by pally Roland Hermans. And the music
         consists of several covers." (JW)
(#1)
  TITLE: Ritmo de la Noche
 ARTIST: Mystic
COMMENT: "This is the title theme and means in English: Rhythm of the night.
         It contains 5 tracks: 3 normal and 2 separate digi tracks consisting
         of a drum track and some several chords track. Was first made with
         Protracker on my old and trusty Amiga 500." (JW)
(#2)
COMMENT: "The row of notes (not the bass or lead) is borrowed from a music I
         heard in the heroic cartoon series Prince Valiant and is used as high
         score music. It consists again a bass from Tim Follin's Psycho Pigs
         UXB tune 1. Lead is again of Jeroen Tel's Myth tune 3 this time
         without filter. Of course the old trick is used to divide the notes
         over 2 tracks." (JW)
(#3)
  TITLE: I Promised Myself (1:01-1:47)
 ARTIST: Nick Kamen
COMMENT: "This is the ingame music and consists of 3 parts: The first I wrote
         myself, and the 3rd is also self made, hear that super fast bass!
         The second part is a cover, mentioned above." (JW)
(#4)
  TITLE: Hazard
 ARTIST: Richard Marx
COMMENT: "This is the game over tune. Also first use of slide effects
         (portamento) in my music to give that extra edge." (JW)

/Wijnhoven_Joachim/Lullaby.sid
COMMENT: "Called sleeping song because Roland thought it was a song from which
         you get very sleepy. The chords are taken from the beginning of the
         music of a Dutch USA team demo called Nemesis, I made use of some
         sawtooth presets to get that Galway feel. Bassline is simply using a C
         note and the C note an octave higher. Made in Music Assembler which
         was shortened by pally Roland Hermans, so it only occupies memory from
         $1000-$12EF on the C64 which is 3 blocks (less than 1 K!). Neil
         Baldwin's Demonic-Part_1 was an example for me, using 2 tracks for
         lead when the bass is suspended. The nicest thing of the C64 sid chip
         is that you can create a warm analogue sound." (JW)

/Wijnhoven_Joachim/Masterpiece.sid
COMMENT: "An experimental piece. This was the least bad version. Composed on
         piano and by voice." (JW)

/Wijnhoven_Joachim/Merlins_Dream.sid
  TITLE: Double Dragon III [from the Amiga game] (2:48-3:57)
 ARTIST: Andrew Barnabas (Night-Shade/Ecstasy)
COMMENT: "This is my Mekka Symposium 2001 SID competition entry. It finished
         11th from the 29 and got 32 votes. Too bad there is no independent
         jury on the Mekka party so if you know a lot of people who will vote
         for you, you will finish 1st. The first part (from 0:00 to 0:45) was
         made back in '92. The rest was made in 2 weeks in 2001. At the party
         sids are played up to 4 minutes. So I had to stop at the end of the
         4th minute. Since this msx contains a sample beat it must be played on
         an old sid, as was done on the party. You had to mention on the entry
         sheet which sid they had to use. Too bad the music was played too soft
         on the party (held during Easter). The zax might be a bit too
         long-winded. The DD III part was converted from an Amiga MOD" (JW)

/Wijnhoven_Joachim/Merlins_Dream_PSID.sid
  TITLE: Double Dragon III [from the Amiga game] (2:48-3:57)
 ARTIST: Andrew Barnabas (Night-Shade/Ecstasy)
COMMENT: "This is my Mekka Symposium 2001 SID competition entry. It finished
         11th from the 29 and got 32 votes. Too bad there is no independent
         jury on the Mekka party so if you know a lot of people who will vote
         for you, you will finish 1st. The first part (from 0:00 to 0:45) was
         made back in '92. The rest was made in 2 weeks in 2001. At the party
         sids are played up to 4 minutes. So I had to stop at the end of the
         4th minute. Since this msx contains a sample beat it must be played on
         an old sid, as was done on the party. You had to mention on the entry
         sheet which sid they had to use. Too bad the music was played too soft
         on the party (held during Easter). The zax might be a bit too
         long-winded. The DD III part was converted from an Amiga MOD" (JW)

/Wijnhoven_Joachim/Merlins_Dream_V2.sid
COMMENT: "Look at text enclosed with Merlin's Dream. Music is the same but the
         sample beat was removed and replaced by normal C64 drums which were
         attached to the bass notes. This tune was used in diskmag
         Arachnophobia #21." (JW)

/Wijnhoven_Joachim/Pang_Remix.sid
  TITLE: Puff, The Magic Dragon
 ARTIST: Peter, Paul & Mary
COMMENT: "Original music used terrible presets! I also added some chords, which
         turned out quite nicely I think. Lead preset is same as bass one. This
         is the preset I've used most." (JW)

/Wijnhoven_Joachim/Parasol_Stars_Boss.sid
  TITLE: Lambada
 ARTIST: Kaoma
COMMENT: "This is like the Ingame tune a conversion of an Amiga Octamed file I
         found on the net. Same presets used as in the Ingame tune. Only a
         slide effect had to be inserted which wasn't in the other Parasol
         Stars tunes. This zax sounds a bit like the old Latin Lambada tune by
         Kaoma from 1987. Of course this tune was played during the game after
         the normal levels when the big boss appeared" (JW)

/Wijnhoven_Joachim/Parasol_Stars_High_Score.sid
  TITLE: Parasol Stars High Score [from the Amiga game]
 ARTIST: <?>
COMMENT: "This is like the Ingame tune a conversion of an Amiga Octamed file I
         found on the net. Same presets used as in the Ingame tune. The
         original Amiga tune had 4 tracks but the extra track was used as an
         echo of the lead track so the essence of the tune is in this sid. I
         wonder who is the original composer of these tunes. The only name I
         can come up with is Galway!" (JW)

/Wijnhoven_Joachim/Parasol_Stars_Ingame.sid
  TITLE: Parasol Stars ingame [from the Amiga game]
 ARTIST: <?>
COMMENT: "This is a conversion of an Amiga Octamed file I found on the net. It
         was my entry for the Vision party 2001. It was the best music but
         since there were not enough entries, all entries were put into 1
         competition. It finished 4th. All presets were done by buddy Roland
         Hermans which very much sound like the Amiga ones. Great job! I always
         wanted to convert this tune and fortunately I found the Med files
         which saved me from very much work. 11 presets were used among a
         filter bass preset. I really like this tune! Anyone also wants to make
         a complete game conversion?" (JW)

/Wijnhoven_Joachim/Rolfie_Title_Remix.sid
COMMENT: "This is a remix of the title theme I made for a children's cd rom I
         am making together with some pallies of mine. The cd rom is called
         "Rolfie Op Wereldreis" which is translated: "Rolfie On A World Trip"
         and is about a cat which travels around the world visiting 10
         countries from which England and America are divided into 2 pages. So
         in total there are 12 different country drawings, a title page, a
         credits page and and end page. With every page there comes an
         appropriate, spheric music plus lyrics about what can be seen in the
         drawings. All the sight seeing objects can be seen in a picture of
         each country. For instance in Egypt you can see: some pyramids, a
         sphinx, the Nile, a palm tree, some background items and Rolfie the
         cat on a camel. When you click on an object it starts to animate and a
         WAV-file begins to play making e.g. a camel sound and telling a story
         about e.g. a camel. This title tune is apart from the melody altered
         heavily to let it sound ok on the C64. This is the first tune I made
         since 1992 which was spread, so you can call it a sort of test tune.
         And this is also the first tune made for mainly Poland based group
         Axelerate which has died in the beginning of 2001. All presets are the
         same as in Linko music except before every bass sound (from 0:15),
         there is a kick drum sound added. Idea for 3 track chords in beginning
         is from Reyn Ouwehand's Deadlock (brilliant title tune). Wind sound
         was added, as always if something needs to be added, it was done by
         pally Roland 'Neo' Hermans. Hope U like it!" (JW)

/Wijnhoven_Joachim/Shadow_of_the_Beast_demo.sid
  TITLE: Shadow of the Beast [from the Amiga game]
 ARTIST: David Whittaker
COMMENT: "I sent my version to Psygnosis Software in England but they used
         Fredrik Segerfalk (Moppe)'s version. Pity! Thought my version was
         better! This music is played while running through the landscape in
         the beginning of the game. Bass and percussion were put into 1 track.
         Some wave on sounds were put on the presets of the track with the fast
         notes to get that galloping effect in, which was also there in
         original sound." (JW)

/Wijnhoven_Joachim/Super_Mario_Land.sid
  TITLE: Super Mario Land, Level 1 [from the Gameboy game]
 ARTIST: Koji Kondo
COMMENT: Covers an Amiga MOD cover of the Nintendo original. "Another
         Protracker MOD conversion. The 4th percussion track was left out. The
         lead might be a bit different because of those special echo thingies
         in the original." (JW)

/Wijnhoven_Joachim/Tough_Guys.sid
COMMENT: "This karate game was made like Forester by a pally of mine: Ramon
         "Bonzobrok" v.d. Laar. I got some help from Charles Deenen (ex-Maniacs
         of Noise). Before he went to the States he used to live on cycling
         distance of my domicile in the Southern part of Holland." (JW)
(#1)
COMMENT: "He [Charles Deenen] helped me with the first part of the title tune,
         also I copied a cd from him with Japanese music (forgot the name)
         which was the basis for the last part of the title theme, from 1:27,
         and the complete level zax." (JW)
(#2)
COMMENT: "Furthermore the gong at the end of the level sound is taken from
         Hubbard's IK+ and also Rob's tune was an example for me to get a bit
         agressive level sound." (JW)
(#3)
  TITLE: Chambers of Shaolin, Tune #2
 ARTIST: Michael Hendriks & Holger Knipping
COMMENT: "The melody was found using the black keys on my keyboard which always
         bring an oriental melody. Also we (I always cooperate with Roland
         Hermans, who is a good programmer) got some tips from Charles how to
         get an oriental sound by making appropiate presets (instruments) using
         arpeggio's and flute sounds. As you can hear much transpose is used in
         all songs. This is the end of game tune." (JW)

/Wijnhoven_Joachim/Truman_Show_Opening.sid
  TITLE: Truman Show Opening [from the movie]
 ARTIST: Philip Glass
COMMENT: "Before the movie Truman Show this music was composed and
         released on several other cd's. It's my 2nd Glass cover and
         there will follow more. This is converted from a midi file I
         found on the net. All presets are the same but the bass
         preset is a bit softer. This preset is from Jonathan Dunn's
         Robocop. Very nice pulse thingy in it. The lead from 1:55
         is done by me. Original was played by piano as only
         instrument." (JW)

/Wijnhoven_Joachim/Turrican_III_Level_3.sid
  TITLE: Level 3 [from the Amiga game Turrican III]
 ARTIST: Chris Hülsbeck
COMMENT: "Another MIDI file conversion taken from the Video Game Music Archive
         (www.vgmusic.com). It was first intended to be a high score music for
         a shoot'em up from Protovision, but they didn't want covers in their
         games. Roland and I first put the filter on the arpeggios like Robocop
         title but in most cases it is best to put it on the bass like we did
         in this tune. I think this is one of the best basslines I ever heard.
         It's pretty complex! Chris is/was probably the best German computer
         zax composer ever. I think! The arpeggios are not chords they consist
         of 2 notes. Lead is from Dunn's Robocop title, rest by Roland. Hope U
         like it!" (JW)

/Wijnhoven_Joachim/Yogis_French_Anthem.sid
  TITLE: La Marseillaise (French National Anthem)
 ARTIST: Claude Joseph Rouget de Lisle
COMMENT: "I first made this tune on the Amiga because it was easier in 1992 to
         use Protracker. It was meant for a C64 game Roland and I planned to
         make (Red Baron) which was never finished. The funny thing with the
         game was that you had to put the telly or monitor on its side! So you
         got an arcade feel to the game.  This tune was used in a note spread
         by JSL also from Protovision." (JW)

/Wilson_Mark/Volfied_PSID.sid
(#1)
COMMENT: "The speech in it is Kelly Le Brock from the film Weird Science...
         It's complete lack of relevance to Volfied is because I originally did
         the tune just as a demo, but authors of the game heard it, liked it
         and wanted to use it as the intro." (MW)
         This tune uses a "two-channel" digi on top of the 3 SID voices.

/Wilson_Mark/Xenomorph.sid
COMMENT: All samples are from the film 'Aliens'. This music also uses a
         "two-channel digi" on top of 3 SID voices.

/Wilson_Mark/Xenomorph_PSID.sid

         "two-channel digi" on top of 3 SID voices.

/Wilson_Mark/Xenon_2_Megablast.sid
  TITLE: Megablast [from Into The Dragon]
 ARTIST: Bomb the Bass
COMMENT: "It's a conversion of Megablast by Bomb The Bass as used in the Amiga
         game. I did it after reading in some magazine about a possible C64
         conversion, and sent it Mirrorsoft "on spec" I don't know if the 64
         version was ever done, and if it was it didn't have my music in it."
         (MW)
         Actually, every conversion of Xenon 2 that had any music at all was
         covering this music.

### MICHAEL WINTERBERG #######################################################

/Winterberg_Michael/
COMMENT: "It's a long time ago that I composed sounds for the good old C64. But
         all I remember is that it was a very great time with much fun.
         My composing started in the years 1983/84 when I programmed my own
         music-editor and the music-play-routine. I made an extra-routine for
         each sound. From music to music I changed that routine to get
         different sounds.
         I have made some musics, good and bad sounds. But I have tried to make
         people happy with listening to my music." (Comment by Winterberg
         himself.)

/Winterberg_Michael/Android_Music_Mix.sid
  TITLE: Pink Panther Theme (1:30-1:50)
 ARTIST: Henry Mancini
COMMENT: Cover is out-of-tune.

/Winterberg_Michael/Christmas_Mix.sid
  TITLE: Ihr Kinderlein kommet (0:47-1:58)
 ARTIST: Johann Abraham Peter Schulz
COMMENT: German Christmas song.

### YIP ######################################################################

/Yip/Megasound-editor.sid
  TITLE: Finlandia
 ARTIST: Jean Sibelius

/Yip/Omega_Man.sid
COMMENT: This tune was ripped from a demo by Yip, named Omega Man - in the
         scroll he wrote that it was used in the game Omega Man, which didn't
         sell that well. However, Omega Man is also known as "Time Trax".

/Yip/Scroll_Machine.sid
(#1)
   NAME: 5th Dream About Happiness
COMMENT: Similar to /Yip/Yip_unknown.sid.
(#4)
   NAME: Autumn
(#8)
  TITLE: Malbrouk s'en va-t-en guerre
 ARTIST: Traditional
COMMENT: an Arab tune that was brought to Europe during the crusades and
         became popular during the french revolution, ever sinced spawned
         many songs, including "For He's a Jolly Good Fellow".
(#10)
  TITLE: Uuno Turhapuro [from the movie]
 ARTIST: Jaakko Salo
COMMENT: Title theme of many Finnish "Uuno Turhapuro" movies.

/Yip/Uuno_Turhapuro.sid
(#1)
  TITLE: Uuno Turhapuro [from the movie]
 ARTIST: Jaakko Salo
COMMENT: Title theme of many Finnish "Uuno Turhapuro" movies.
(#2)
  TITLE: Autumn
 ARTIST: Jori Olkkonen (Yip)
COMMENT: Another version of Yip's tune from Scroll Machine, played using a
         simpler music routine, because the original music routine interfered
         with the game's code: "I had to ask Jori to make the music with
         slightly less sparse synching, but when I did that the sound quality
         dropped a bit. The result was a bearable compromise. The screen
         glitches were almost gone and the music still sounds fairly good."
         (From an interview with Pasi Hytönen, the programmer of the game, in
         MikroBITTI 4/87)
